Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: debbie_williamswood
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 nights and had really relaxing time. The staff were friendly, the service was good and the restuaurants attached to Goodwood were excellent. It is also really clean. The style is colonial, so don't expect contemporary. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, big rooms, great pool and amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Beachmama30
Reviews.Content: We love staying at this hotel. It is our favorite place to stay for a shopping trip on Orchard. The pools and locale are an oasis in a busy city. The hotel always has lovely amenities and the afternoon tea is a special treat with many delicious selections.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay...”
Reviews.Author: svm38
Reviews.Content: I think our stay at this hotel could best be described as 'average'. we chose the hotel for its historic feel and it is a lovely building but certainly didn't wow us. The hotel is located 5 minutes stroll from Orchard Road and the metro station and so is withing easy reach of all locations. Our room was very cramped due to the extra bed for our daughter - not really a room to be used for any more than a double or twin. furnishings were good and the bathroom was average. we did request a pool view and received one but from what i could see, non of the first floor rooms had balconies which was such a shame as it would have been lovely to enjoy the view we had. We opted for a 'deal' on arrival which was sold as a one price for breakfast, internet and a couple of extras - just be aware that when you actually come to pay for this 'one price' offer, they will add tax onto it which bumps the price up when staying a few days! Breakfast was buffet style and was again average for both quality of food and choice. Staff were nice and most of the time helpful and friendly. Room cleaning staff were tremendous, always on hand and very efficient. Would we recommend this hotel to friends? probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: nayanayanaya
Reviews.Content: Good stay @ historical hotel, Goodwood Park. Excellent location with only 5 minutes walk from centre of Orchard Road. Even thought it's near the crowded area but the hotel surrounding is quite. The room is spacious and well maintain. We had good night sleep. The bedroom is complete with good size bed, 2 pillows each, spacious bathroom, good water-pressure, and also good signal for WiFi internet (quite pricey SGD 30). The housekeeper cleans the room twice a day. Some area needs to be upgraded though; entertainment system is the room did not run smoothly, window is not airtight enough, and few finishing on the door. The hotel has few good restaurants, Nanjing restaurant is must try. Make sure to book well before, to get good rates. I'd definitely recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy boutique hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: Andy7P
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to find a low rate at Goodwood Park and jumped at chance to try it. GP looks like a historic hotel from the outside, but that is a small part of the building. Inside it isn't that historic, but has been thoroughly updated. The decor is modern and upscale and classy. Main public area has glass walls looking onto the broad pool area, and it is a low rise 3 floor building - about the only place in Singapore. Rooms are very large and with the same natural light wood and stone color scheme as in the public areas. Great food and service. Overall a really low key understated but luxurious atmosphere. Location as mentioned can't be beaten - right in the center off Scotts by Orchard Rd. I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Veggietabolos
Reviews.Content: We had no complaints about Goodwood Hotel - the rooms were spacious, bright, clean and easily accommodated three adults (me and my parents - in their 60s). The hotel is very grand and beautifully maintained. The rooms are a bit pricey, but reasonable given what competing hotels are charging (hotels in Singapore are pricey in general, I think). Hotel staff were smart, quick and very helpful. We asked all sorts of silly questions but they were very patient with us and provided nothing short of top-notch service. The location was perfect - walking distance to the bustle of Orchard Rd. but far enough to get a good night's rest. Would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Colonial Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigTaps
Reviews.Content: Really great looking hotel in a great location if you want to be close the majour shopping areas.. Old and traditional part has been added to, although you would hardly notice the addition. Otherwise staff are first class, the room (I stayed in room for in the old part) is not spectacular but it is more than addequet despite the bathroom being a little small and old fashioned. Two copmlaints, which I would not expect from a hotel of this class a) Paying for Wi-fi and b), they have problem with their wake up calls (6am call on the wrong day!), so that is why only 4*

Reviews.Title: “Heritage hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Pranab D
Reviews.Content: A lot of history in this heritage hotel harking back to the city's colonial past. Very well located just off Orchard Road on Scotts Road. Easy access to the shopping in Orchard and just 5 minutes by taxi to Chinatown, Little India, Arab Street and Holland Village. The high tea seems to be a favorite attraction but I didn't have time to try it. As expected, friendly and efficient staff. If you need your TV fix you will be disappointed. The image and sound quality is poor [especially if you're used to digital].

Reviews.Title: “Great start”
Reviews.Author: RJT06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Goodwood Park for 4 nights at the start of a six week holiday. We were delighted with this hotel. We hate large impersonal hotels and this was just right. The staff were extremely helpful and never once forgot our names. We had a superb meal in the fine dining restaurant. It is within easy walking distance of Orchard Rd and as we used the hop on hop off buses we got to see everything very easily. We were disappointed to find that Raffles for afternoon tea was full on both the weekend days and had tea at Goodwood Park instead which was perfect (and a great deal cheaper). Unlike another guest reviewer we found the cost very reasonable. It pays to shop around! We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HUMIDITY!!!”
Reviews.Author: ericvietnam
Reviews.Content: I have been linving in Vietam for 20 years, so really I don't mind humidity, but my room at goodwood park Hotel was so humide, I couldn't beleive it. I even asked the room service to change the bedsheet because they were wet. i asked recpetion for help, but nobody did anything. The toilet paper rolls were falling apart becasue of to much humidity. We had a terrible stay. Location is perdfect, the italian restaurent is one of the best in Asia, but the room.... it is like sleeping in a aquarium!

Reviews.Title: “Serviced Apartments Review, It's alright”
Reviews.Author: Live_frm_AsiaPac
Reviews.Content: This review is for the serviced apartments at Good Wood Park; these are the apartments at the back of the Good Wood Park Hotel at 22 Scotts. I stayed in the service apartment for 7 nights with my young son, and it was a mixed experience but generally positive. First the apartments are located at the back of the hotel, a seperate building which you have to walk across a road and through two parking lots, no sidewalks, to reach. At check-in there was a mistake in my booking which required a call from our travel agent to resolve. Once at the apartments, there are two elevators which service the six floors. The elevators ran smoothly and we never had to wait long. The building itself is pretty dated but well kept. The apartment was a split level with the bedroom on the top by the front door, and the living/dining, bathroom and kitchen on the bottom. The apartment had a generally damp feeling so things never quite dried when I hung clothes up. The couch was incredibly uncomfortable but there was a nice reading chair with ottaman. The couch could to convert into a double bed, but the mattress looked very thin and cheap. The kitchen was well stocked with cooking pots, cutlery/dishes, and glasses. The fridge and stove were small but adequet, and there was plenty of shelf space. Bring your own salt/pepper. No brew coffee machine was available; but a hot water maker and instant coffee. The bathroom was clean and well kept. It is recently renovated. There was also a patio which opened from the living room, with a dining table and two chairs. The lock to the door is low so a small child could reach it. The patio railing is a half wall with a built in sitting bench next to the edge; those with little children would want to be careful about this. The bedroom has glass looking out to the living room so you couldn't really have one person sleeping and the other in the living room watching tv. There is no door to the bedroom. There was a closet under the stair case which was great for storing our luggage. Room service was very good; timely, good food, hot. The pricing is middle expensive, relative to other Singapore hotels. Hotel food is generally very expensive in Singapore ($25-45 SD per dish). Complimentary bottled water was replaced daily. Housekeeping was very good (did the dishes!) There is an Isten grocery store at the Ion shopping center (5 mins walk) but it is geared to Asian food products. Find a Cold Store grocery to find more European/American food (Mac&Cheese for example). There is a Pizza Hut in Lucky Plaza which is about 5 mins walk. To get from the apartment to Scotts road, you have to walk down a road (no sidewalk) and a parking lot. All the parking lot walking really reduced the whole experience. It feels like the step-child of the hotel. Internet access is $28 per day *per device*. Additional devices are $28/day each device. All told, I'd stay again but if I found other serviced apartments, I'd try them rather than staying at the Good Wood again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, warm hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the midst of a lovely garden yet in the heart of Singapore. It is only steps from Orchard Road but is quiet and away from the hubbub. The hotel has character yet has been modernized to the 21st C in a warm and elegant way. The staff are very friendly and helpful from the front desk onward. The restaurants are excellent including the coffee shop and the Chinese restaurant. Our first room beside the Mayfair Pool on the ground floor felt s little musty so we changed to a second floor room which was lovely. The pool settings are extremely pleasant. We have no hesitancy in giving the Goodwood Park our highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Colonial style with modern trappings”
Reviews.Author: peekay68
Reviews.Content: Singapore generally has two main types of hotel - the concrete brand-name high-rise, or the old colonial style mansion. Raffles, of course, is the best-known of the latter, and there's no denying its talent in evoking olde-worlde charm. But it gets a decent run for its money from the Goodwood Park. The GP is about 500 meters from the splendid Orchard Rd (surely high among the world's most attractive shopping strips), and sits a block back, haunched on a hilltop corner with a slightly haughty demeanor. Inside, it's lovely - cool, restored (or should that be maintained?), two excellent swimming pools (one centred terrifyingly in the rear courtyard where almost every room can watch you strip off and swim) and one blessedly more discrete off one of the wings. All mod cons are there - wifi is fast, service is good, food OK, prices on booze etc horrific (welcome to Singapore) conference facilities, some nice poolside spaces for cocktails and events. The balcony rooms are best, but most rooms are spacious, air-conditioned beautifully against the sticky Singaporean climate. Just be sure to specify that you don't want a twin room - unless of course you do want a twin room, in which case you're very likely to be in luck. I did hear a couple of growling businessmen complain that it's too far from the CBD area, and it's true, it is a fair hike by taxi. But it's close to shops and facilities, so CBD/financial and other business types should seek out something on the other side of town and leave the lovely Goodwood Park to the rest of us.

Reviews.Title: “Truely Heritage Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Efleet
Reviews.Content: Nice, heritage rich and spacious hotel to stay in; In contrary to the Singapore's context of high rise hotels, this hotel really stand up "high" with its own colonial charm. Check out the wooden window blinds, and ceiling fan, yes ceiling fan in a 5-star hotel room, you can see their efforts in mixing the old and modern furniture into one picture! Besides, thumb up for their service upon checking in (everyone needs that especially after 14 hours flight) and Of course, this hotel itself in the Orchard shopping belt! Would definitely want to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard location”
Reviews.Author: debrina108
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Singapore for a 5 day break but wanted to stay in a central location close to the Botanical Gardens and Orchard Road. For location, this hotel is terrific. The staff are friendly and helpful. However, my husband and I love to travel and stay in hotels that have character and history, which we thought from the photos and reputation that this hotel would have... sadly, it is not the Colonial jewel we were expecting. It is much closer to an average business hotel in a good location. It is not quiet which is a good thing and is very conveniently located close to public transport. Taxis were a problem so plan well in advance if you will need one. Would we stay here again? Probably not as we would like to explore other options with historical charm and character.

Reviews.Title: “Large Hotel with all the facilities”
Reviews.Author: WestSussexCaroline
Reviews.Content: Goodwood Park Hotel is more of a commercial hotel but it has a lot of character with the building dating back to 1900. It has been fully modernised and we had an OKish room which looked over the small swimming pool. It was described as a deluxe double room but it was quite small with twin beds which we pushed together. We were given a complimentary welcome drink ticket to use during our stay and were disappionted to find that it was for a choice of two fruit juices only. It is rather a distance from the main attractions of Singapore and so some form of transport is needed. We did the MRT a couple of times but decided that it was easier to use a taxi when we wanted to go out. The restaurants in the hotel were very expensive. We had our first meal at the Chinese restaurant in the hotel because it was too late to go out. We found the menu very difficult to understand and the waitress was not very helpful. We didn't seem to get what we thought we had ordered and for the price it was very poor value. Breakfast was included and that was excellent, offering a wide range including eggs cooked to order.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive on the Outside”
Reviews.Author: E K
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to stay at the Goodwood Park hotel for close to a decade now. The glorious white colonial-style building conjured up images of a luxurious, glamourous and classy interior, without being overly modernistic So, when we planned a trip to Singapore, and found a really great deal, we were elated. Imagine my surprise when the taxi pulled into the driveway. The main entrance wasn't located in the main iconic building but behind it. The reception area, while still considered smart by most standards, was more like the reception area you would expect from a business hotel. There are 2 pools, the main one near the main reception area, and another smaller one servicing the Parklane wing (which houses the apartments). The swimming pools were quite basic with not much ambience. Our room was located in the Tower block as per my request. The room and bathroom were quite sizeable. Room was meticulous cleaned and tidied daily, so kudos for that. But being an old hotel, it still does not feature a separate shower stall. One had to climb inside and stand in the tub to shower and the shower was leaking and water would leak onto the floor when we showered. Location-wise, it's great as it's right in the heart of the city. One can walk to the amazing shopping strip, Orchard Road in a few minutes. But being located on a slight promontory, the 2-3 times daily that we had to walk up and down the little "hill" soon got a little tiring. I guess if I sound harsh on this review, it may be because I had such high expectations. It was, at the end of a day, still a very good hotel but I guess I was a victim of my own expectations. The question is, would I stay there again. I would probably say "NO", and certainly not at the current rates.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic hotel, slightly away from the bustle of Orchard Street”
Reviews.Author: Nell214
Reviews.Content: Originally built as a club for German expats (back in the early 20th century), Goodwood Park became a luxury hotel decades ago. It's one of the few low-rise notes in Singapore (Raffles Hotel is another), and it has a large, swimming pool which - when we stayed - wasn't used much although it's great for anyone who likes serious swimming. There's another pool - more of a play pool, certainly not for swimmers. Service was good (especially the housekeeping). Love the location, although the hotel isn't really geared up for people who use the MRT (or buses) as the driveway is definitely for cars not pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with old world charm.”
Reviews.Author: fredhardman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Goodwood Park on three occasions whilst travelling through Singapore and have found the standards consistantly high. It is a heritage hotel but does not have heritage hotel prices; if you get the right package. The reservation and check in staff are particularly helpful and will try to accommodate any special requests if they are able. The high tea,which is a special feature of the hotel is particularly spectacular. We have always enjoyed this hotel and will return.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: FMoha
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the three nights I spent at Goodwood. I loved the history and charm of the place, and would've loved to have heard and experienced more of the history and legacy (am really surprised that they haven't done more than the stock standard for preservation and celebation of history). The service was wonderful, my room was quiet, clean and everything I would want for the price I payed. The high tea was excellent and I would recommend a couple of vinos at their bar stocked with great selections of wines. A hop, skip and jump from the hustle and bustle of the main district, which is handy. I would recommend this for fellow travellers, and I will stay here when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Room, No Service”
Reviews.Author: Aidin489
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights, Hotel is really a heritage, but I guess now it has been modified to a food court. There are restaurants those don't your signature on bill as claim they're out of the hotel! One of them, Gaia, is located just beside of the main old entrance which you see in all pictures. But location is great Nd rooms are clean, but if you are looking for real luxury you won't find it there. Instead you'll feel you've left by your own. No one will smile you or even say good afternoon :) I think there is a serious lack of personnel there, I found them also a little impolite but maybe it's because of their Calture that never smile. Also every where in the room you'll find a paper asking you politely not to steal anything :( Finally, I've been in more luxury hotels in Hong Kong, Luala Lumpur and Dubai with much less price.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil Yourself in Goodwood Park Hotel's luxury”
Reviews.Author: nitinsoni80
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel for 3 days on a business travel. From the first view, you will find this Hotel legendary. Rooms are specious, with a good view of surroundings. The decor is classic and make you feel of a colonial charm. I like their restaurants' selections. Specially, the set menu in lunch is quite impressive. Although, lot of improvement can be done in Breakfast offerings. Their staff is very well mannered, helpful and friendly. Overall, a great experience which one would like to have many times. It is expensive. But still, less than what you get there. Dont miss it, if you can pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Handy, Colonial Style Place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lymebdr
Reviews.Content: The Goodwood Park is a "special" hotel close to the main shopping street in Singapore - it's not a "high rise", but a traditional hotel around a nice pool, upscale throughout, and very convenient. We have stayed there over the years, probably a dozen times and never had a problem - the service is great, the front desk and conciege are most helpful. You can walk to the (terrific) subway (get a 3 day "tourist pass") and get anywhere in Singapore easily,cheaply and cleanly! You can visit all the tourist places using the tourist pass. If you really want a treat, - visit during the Christmas period when Singapore is FULL of lights and festivities!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, but service getting worse!”
Reviews.Author: jammy321
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the good wood park hotel 12 times.........8 times between 2007-8 and 4 in 2011. After staying there for so long, you would expect an upgrade or at least a recognition of who we are but none at all. The hotel itself is very nice. Lots of history and décor very generally very trendy.....just some bits getting slightly dated. The rooms are very plain and simple but all the same very attractive. The main pool is absolutely lovely to swim in......right in the middle of such historic buildings and surrounded by skyscrapers. Service unfortunately has got worse each time we come. Staff are quite surly and there's never a "Good morning" or "Good evening" as you pass the staff. Breakfast is definitely the hotel's biggest let-down. Food is very nice but cold and service can be at times disappointing........one morning they seated us in the rubbishy area down the side just to suit them. Some of the staff can be quite unpleasant but that is not the case with others......some are lovely. Overall, the hotel is generally very lovely but with just some let downs. You can get better in Singapore for slightly more the same price so for the price, you should give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Standards go down”
Reviews.Author: fedn
Reviews.Content: This is no longer a hotel for business people. No real desk with a decent chair in the room. Hotel service standard still friendly but less perfect than before. Bar now closes at 10:30 pm! Hotel seems to primarily cater for noisy Japanese girl tours, I have the impression that their main focus is now on tourist and tour groups. Its a pity that they take this direction as this was one of my favorite hotels in Asia for many years. Will try probably the Fullerton or the Mandarin marina next time.

Reviews.Title: “Character, comfort, space and great service without spending a fortune”
Reviews.Author: flyingshuttle
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels. Singapore has more than its share of characterless super- lux hotels. This isn't one of them. The former Teutonic Club in Singapore, its a grand, old, low rise building. It has been well modernised, rooms usually come with sitting room and bedroom, as well as two bathrooms, all for a reasonable nightly price. There are two courtyard swimming pools, a great in-house bakery, a good dim sum restaurant. The staff are helpful and attentive, it's quiet and the air conditioning works but isn't oppressive. I usually have appalling jet lag in Singapore, but this is a great plea to recover, to dash out to the shops on foot, or to meet friends, or just to have a great meal. A great alternative to those who don't want to pay Raffles prices or be part of a tourist attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful heritage hotel”
Reviews.Author: wiars
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a stop over to see family in nz. Gorgeous heritage hotel. Rooms very spacious and light overlooking the main swimming pool in the main hotel. Facilities great - staff very attentive. We arrived at 9 am and were very quickly escorted to our rooms. To think that you are just off orchard road this is a tiny little haven in the midst of nuzzle. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes to be near orchard road but wants a bit of peace also. Breakfast was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Kramia
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a ground floor suite opening to the pool. Room was spacious and the slidings doors that encased the bedroom meant a lovely dark room for a midday nap, most welcome after a long flight! Loved the colonial feel of the hotel, breakfast was pleasant and the staff friendly enough. The location is excellent being in such close proximity to Orchard Road. Reasonably good value given everything in Singapore is on the pricey side. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints and a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Olive1920
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our way to Australia. The Hotel location is great for Orchard Road shops. Staff very accommodating and service was generally good. Sampled room service, the coffee lounge and the restaurant opposite reception all very good with costs about average for this standard of hotel. Room on the 1st floor and overlooking the internal pool was on the small size but was as booked and was clean and comfortable. Very quiet even though there were weddings taking place on the same floor. Afternoon tea in the coffee lounge seemed popular with locals. We didn't enter by the grand entrance as pictures might indicate and so this was slightly disappointing when the taxi swerved around to the side entrance. We were shown to our room straight away and our luggage arrived shortly after. Otherwise no real complaints and overall a pleasant stay. Would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “V. Good. But 5*?”
Reviews.Author: NeilandAnn
Reviews.Content: Q. What is a 5* hotel? The Goodwood Park claims to be 5* but so too do the nearby Marriott, & the Hyatt and down at the Harbour area: the Mandarin Oriental and the Raffles Hotel - amongst others. Singapore is positively awash with 5* hotels. The GP's facade is impressive enough, but, sadly, guests are driven passed the wide and imposing staircase and deposited at the far side of the building, at the less impressive 'tradesman's entrance' (that description  is very unfair - but I am reporting on a 5* hotel!).  If 5* stands for luxury, then I am afraid the foyer and reception area of the hotel just don't cut the mustard. Yes, it's functional and clean and tidy - but 5*? compared with the other hotels mentioned? Sadly not. OK,  in the hotel:  what about the facilities? There are no designer boutiques, & there is only one bar. But there is a restaurant, and a coffee bar (once breakfast has finished) and a delightful cake shop. There are also two swimming pools and a well equipped (if quite small) gym. Or does 5* stand for the quality / size of the bedroom? In this case, the GP fares well. Our room was spacious, fully equipped with large flat screen TV etc and a very comfortable king size  bed. The in-room Wi-Fi (a must for me; away from my business) was just perfect - fast & free! But the bathroom, I'm afraid, wasn't large- it wasn't too small - it was adequate; but, again, I am reviewing a 5* hotel.  We didn't need much service as we were only there 2 nights, but what service we did need was speedy and friendly and well-informed. Just as you would hope and expect. In conclusion, the Goodwood park is not the most luxurious hotel in Singapore. For 'luxury' it is down the pecking order. But, its' position is good (a few minutes walk from Orchard Road and the MTR), it is of a very good general standard and, in particular, the main bedroom is excellent. As we'd booked the hotel along with our flights it's difficult to give an actual price comparison between the GP and the other 5* hotels mentioned, but I would be absolutely flabbergasted if it didn't compare very well and wasn't, in fact, far better value.  How much will you pay to walk across large marble floored receptions? or to visit in-house designer boutiques? at the end of the day, that is what it probably boils down to.  If your preference is a grandiose, dramatic reception area flanked by shops selling Rolex and Hermes than the GP is probably not for you. If, however, you'd like a spotlessly clean, efficient,  well-run hotel with all normal facilities and with a very good bedroom area that is more-than-likely far better value for money then the GP will not disappoint. So, I am not sure when I will be back in Singapore again, but I hope to be one day - and I will be certainly checking if they have a room for me at the Goodwood Park hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired,,,and shabby”
Reviews.Author: seasiasj
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 'Parklane' suites...overpriced and shabby. Did not appreciate walking through a car park and laundry/catering facilities to feel part of the main hotel. Poolside area was tired/over grown and a small lukewarm cup of coffee cost six pounds sterling!!!

Reviews.Title: “My overall favourite hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JonasCh
Reviews.Content: This is in the top of hotels I´ve been to, it´s not the big hotel chain feeling and is not so big only two stories high, more like home away from home. There is great history with this place. Luxious certainly, perfect location and if possible try to get a room by the inner pool, just perfect...A Nasi Goreng by the pool, just love it....actually we have stayed here many times through the years, both in business and with our family....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Castlefordj
Reviews.Content: Love the Goodwood. They go out of their way to please. I was moved from a noisy to a quiet room and 2 out of 3 duty managers were superb. Afternoon tea stunning and as a solo traveller I used room service which was also excellent. Only 1 glitch was that I found a respiratory mask and tube under the bed, which felt a bit strange and led me to wonder what medical condition a previous occupant had suffered from. Anyway, I suppose these things happen....if I return to Singapore the Goodwood park will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Refuge from City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Wiland
Reviews.Content: The selling point of Goodwood Park Hotel is that it is nested in a quiet corner of Singapore city centre and it is part of Singapore's History, very much like Raffles Hotel. Stay here if you like a nostalgic colonial feel, ample private space, and convenient location. I highly recommend this hotel for long staying visitors. Book the Split Level Studio Room as it is very well furbished. I am new to Trip Advisor but definately not new to travelling. I love this room! For long staying guests; There is a Korean Supermart located conveniently in Far East Plaza. For Japanese guests, head over to Shaw/Lido for a full range of products that Japanese imported products. For Europeans, a new mall along Scotts Road has an NTUC Finest for all essentials you may need to make this your second home. Check In was done in 5 minutes with full hotel check in standards yet it was robotic. Depending on your reserved room type, you will be ushered into different blocks/buildings within the property. My block had no sheltered access and I had to cut across 2 car parks to reach. But hey that is what makes this place so private!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, location but lacking typical Asian charm”
Reviews.Author: LennyV39
Reviews.Content: Excellently located in the Orchard area amidst the many shopping malls, this ***** hotel meets all expectations: luxury, nice restaurants, impeccable service. However, as a European having lived and traveled in Asia for quite some time, I missed the Asian twist.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Kirkpatrick30
Reviews.Content: We have jsut been to Thailand via Singapore. We stayed i night on the outwad journey and one night on the return trip at the perfectly situated Goodwoood Park Hotel. My husband 77 and I 72 have travelled the world together in the last half century and we would rate the service at the Goodwood Park among the best we have ever encountered. The flights to and from Singapore from Johannebsurg arrive and depart at extremely inconvenient times. We arrived at 06h40. The night manager invited us to have a cup fo coffee by the pool while he organised a room - quite a feat as the hotel was almost full.. Within 30 minutes we were installed with our luggage in a magnificent room overlooking the quiet Palm Court pool. On the return we asked for a late check out -22h00!! and we were only charged for an extra half day. As far as value for money is concerned I found this 5 star hotel ticked every box. We would rate it 10 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “a great way to experience singapore”
Reviews.Author: elena c
Reviews.Content: just minutes walk to Orchard Rd yet the hotel is spacious and a true oasis of peace. The restaurants are exellent.... The service is great and the staff is effortlessly polite and efficient... I have been staying at this hotel for 20 years and will keep going back for more!

Reviews.Title: “A little Oasis of Singapore History”
Reviews.Author: onefootforward
Reviews.Content: I was explained by a friend that since the casinos have opened in Singapore there has been a vacuum of talent sucked out of the traditional hotels like the Goodwood. This once proud, centrally located sprawling country club has a certain nostalgic charm. However, don't expect the five star treatment you would at a Hyatt, and regale yourself in the knowledge that you're experiencing a little colonialism in which the lofty, arrogant, old world, partly broken, and somewhat senile concierge perfectly portrays. The outside swimming pool is delightful and well maintained. There's nothing finer than taking an early morning dip and letting the sun's ray peak over the hotel walls. The gym is tiny and in need of a change of location and apparatus. It's like a small child has arranged them in a hurry. The waiting staff were helpful and relaxed only in a way you become after being in the same environment so long. I do like the charming Goodwood, and I enjoyed my stay for 5 days. I would recommend it to couples who would like a break and do a little shopping around Ion or Orchard roads.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service!”
Reviews.Author: Fong A
Reviews.Content: This may not be of total relevance to all the readers here. i have a friend who celebrated her 21st birthday in Goodwood Park Hotel recently. When she went to view the rooms last month, she already informed Catering Sales that it was for her birthday party. They then advised her that she could hold a party there as long as everyone left my 12mn. However, we were chased out of the room by three managers just before 9:30pm. After much negotiation, they allowed everyone to sing her a birthday song before leaving the room. While everyone was singing her the song, the poor girl was in tears and very much affected. Firstly, why is there such poor communication between the security and catering sales department? Granted that other hotel guests need to rest, we were definitely not making a lot of noise. The room was so low profile that some people even had difficultly spotting the room upon reaching the floor. Besides, most of us were from the hospitality industry and so we were even more sure to maintain low noise levels. Secondly, why is it that there are two other parties on the same floor but no one was chased out in the other rooms? It was noted that the guests in the the other rooms seem to look more mature than most of us. Thirdly, what kind of service is this from a '5-star' hotel? Another friend of ours celebrated her birthday in the same hotel, same room type earlier this earlier this year but no one got chased out. I wish to point out to readers here that this hotel seems to give us the impression that they are practicing double standards. If they can do it to locals, what more tourists? Besides, who would want to stay in a hotel that does not care about a guest's situation? Even if the birthday girl was in the wrong, there no attempt to do a service recovery or empathize with her situation. Is this hotel void of empathy? Besides, why did Catering Sales close the deal with her if the hotel does not like its guests to hold parties in the room? To the staff of the hotel: Was your 21st BIrthday spent crying as well? Please give us an explanation, even though it seems the the hotel does not even reply to, or keep track of their feedback form this website. This is definitely a good example of utterly bad service from seemingly reputable hotels. I feel embarrassed that such hotels are hosting tourists on behalf of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel central location”
Reviews.Author: copperiw
Reviews.Content: After a 12 hour flight from London, it was great to arrive at the Goodwood Park Hotel, unfortunately, through no fault of the hotels, we arrived fairly early in the morning, check in wasn't officially until 1400hrs. After explaining our predicament, the hotel managed to accommodate us, and at 10am they found us a room. Hotel is in a central location to Orchard Road, 5 minute walk at most. Room was at the back of the hotel and although comfortable, it just lacked something, considering the price paid. Room had a spacious balcony but overlooked what I would describe as a housing estate. No free WIFI at the hotel, exorbitant charges for WIFI could be had in the lobby area. My advice is a two minute walk down the road to the adjoining shopping centre, overlooking Scotts Road is a coffee bar/restaurant with free WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samson O
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. Infact, i have stayed in many hotels in Singapore but i have not come across the room so spacious, excellent layout, superb breakfast, super staffs, super service etc. Lastly, a nice swimming pool and location too!

Reviews.Title: “Very confusing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nqueenslander
Reviews.Content: When we were checking in we were informed about upgrade, then we had to walk no less than 5 minutes to our room in the furthest corner of the corridor. Looking at the photos now I think I should ask for some money back. We were downgraded, not upgraded, that is for sure. We were put in very dark room with small windows it felt like in prison most of the times. Hotel has so many passages but doesn't have a map or any guest’s information, I couldn't find one in the room any way. I had no idea this hotel had a gym or other swimming pool. Where are they located? Why nobody told me about them? Breakfast was included in the price of our room and it was pleasantly good, though not as plentiful as it was at MBS. We booked that hotel mostly because of the laundry facilities, well it was in separate building altogether and there was no way I could find it on my own. That hotel is a real labyrinth.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of charm”
Reviews.Author: leisuretravellady
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at this hotel - rooms were charming, and the Mayfair pool delightful. The lobby was a bit underwhelming, but a good place for snacks instead of a pricey dinner. Service was excellent, the Chinese restaurant top notch, although restaurant prices were high, and wine was ridiculous! Continental breakfast was surprisingly expensive, but bacon, eggs, tomato and mushrooms were very reasonable. Odd! The Gordon's gin and tonic in the lobby tasted really strange and I had to move to the more expensive Tanqueray. Close to the action, and easy walk to Orchard Road. I'd stay there again instead of the characterless (and pricier) Shangri La where we stayed on our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Imbo
Reviews.Content: Could be a really nice charming boutique historic hotel if it weren't a boring cheesy shopoholic area and didn't try to gouge on food and Internet. No free 15 mins of Internet for me, they wanted $.85/minute to $28/day max. Pool and weight room were nice enough but totally devoid of life. A hot tub/spa would be nice at this price to relax in and maybe chat with other travellers. Very dull for solo travellers - you will want to grab a taxi or subway ride if you want to see anything other than same old same old retail stores. Yes S'pore is expensive, but I suspect I could have done a lot better for the same or less money in a much more interesting area that isn't about nickel and diming. Oh yeah, the space age (Buck Rogers) push button lighting system turned itself on in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Goodwood a bit too Rich for our blood!”
Reviews.Author: Wenlet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Goodwood Hotel for 6 nights just recently and we certainly enjoyed our stay. Not sure I would stay here again as I found the food prices to be outrageous. We did not pay for the breakfast in the price of our room,knowing that Orchard Road was only a few steps away with many, many choices for the palate. I was, however, a bit disappointed after checking in and finding that a cup of coffee was $10. The Continental Breakfast was $26. I feel the prices were a bit high, even though it is Singapore! The room itself was okay, not great. I realize the hotel was built in 1900 so bearing that in mind it is in good shape. From the outside it is very impressive. I had booked our hotel online and I'm not sure if that was why we had the room we did but we had to pass through the business centre area to get to our room. After coming from the pool or workout room it was a bit uncomfortable walking through this area when there were lots of people milling about in the foyer area. There were only 2 plugs in the room and the one in the bathroom would accommodate a razor only. It stopped working at one point but then seemed to come back within a few hours. The plug for the hair dryer was very loose and as a result I had to have my husband hold the plug in the wall while I used it. There was no other way to do it. There were other power issues as well....sometimes the lights would all come on and then off and repeat. Only during the daytime however so not too big of a deal. I found the carpeting in certain areas of the room to be very discolored (particularly dark looking in the corners where it met the wall) and we had an open pot light in the ceiling missing a cover so it glowed at night. The other issue I had was trying to use the internet through the hotel. No one seemed to know if I should be allowed to use it and how much to charge me. In the end they decided to charge me $15 for 30 minutes use and I now see that the hotel advertises Wifi for $30 for 24 hours. Seems a bit disparate to me! On the plus side the staff were outstanding and worked to a very high standard indeed. Everyone was always professional and smiling. Something unique was when you asked for a wake up call you would receive the automated call at the appointed time and then 5 minutes later receive a personal follow up call where they wished you to have a great day. A living snooze button...that was wonderful. The pool was very nice, actually 2 pools to be exact. Hardly anyone used them so it certainly was nice and quiet. We did enjoy our stay and the fact that the hotel is only minutes from Orchard Street and the MRT station made the location of this hotel ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel with elegance and style”
Reviews.Author: Vkayc
Reviews.Content: I came back for more. Excellent service, spacious rooms, afternoon tea to die for. The weddings were fun to watch while resting from shopping and indulging in high tea which I thoroughly recommend. 15 mins free Internet which allowed me to check emails. Prefer Goodwood Park to Raffles as it has retained it's original splendor.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: kn1901 Posted by a Solfaktor traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Probably one of the best in Singapore. We were shown to the room by a very friendly receptionist, who also told us some historical facts about the hotel on our way to the room. Everything is perfect, the location, room sizes (large, from 33 sqm and up), amenities, facilities, restaurants and poolside. We ate at Min Jiang, food was excellent, service was good. A bit pricy, especially beverage and alcohol, but it must be expected at this kind of hotel. I can see that some people complaining on private weddings being held there, I for one did not find it disturbing at all, in fact it was rather nice to watch them. We didn't stay at the hotel area much anyway, so we didn't mind it at all. All in all a great hotel. Service from staff was very good. Will stay here again, it's an oasis in the middle of the city, and it's nice to have a hotel with a garden and a pool, with charm and history, not just another 40-floor unpersonal hotel. As a travel agent I will warmly recommend this hotel for any Singapore-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Stavros C
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5star hotel as presented. Room by the pool was very noisy. it was a big disappointment which forced me to change hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: DrammenDrammen
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this lowrise hotel. The room was big with a very comfy bed. There was a nice balcony which we enjoyed at night. Nice swimmingpool, but no poolbar. We didn't try the restaurants, but it seemed nice. The staff is very nice and helpfull, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “my Best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kazira
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Goodwood Park Hotel as per my stepfather's recommendation. He lived in Singapore during 70s and said this hotel is a historical place and I will love it. And I do! I do love the hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful. Love the high tea on Saturday afternoon. I always love high tea. When I checked in around 2pm I was told that the tables are fully booked. But Frieda Wang at reception had been a big help, she asked the staff at the high tea if they could get me a table if there's any last minute cancellation. And I got my table at the corner where I sat and had a great interview with an MMA instructor/fighter about an MMA event later that night. The pool area is lovely. I love the small pool that not many guests use, it's almost like my private pool. I had a room facing my private pool. Love it so much I will always stay at this hotel. It worth every dime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice gardens and pool areas”
Reviews.Author: tommycafe
Reviews.Content: We had an annual meeting held at this hotel. Rooms were ok. The ballrooms were very nice. Pool areas had a nice gardens and the personnel were very nice to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Trevor A
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveller I often use Singapore as a hub and always use the Goodwood Park as a base. The Goodwood is a very welcome change from all the usual corporate glass and marble chain hotels with no character. The Goodwood has style linked to its heritage with that grand old world charm and feel. An excellent location right in the centre of things and very easy to travel around from. The staff are first class and this was brought home when on my last visit 6th - 10th Oct 11, my business colleague took sick, the staff were A* Plus from organising a doctor to going to the 7/11 and pharmacy. If you are looking for a hotel that is a standardised corporate soulless chain where every room looks the same no matter were in the world you are then the Goodwood is not for you. If you want style and individuality with superb staff in an excellent location, then the Goodwood most certainly is the hotel to chose. Looking forward to being back at the end of the month.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: Great old hotel with a grand feel to it. Excellent staff and facilities. Our stay was too short to make use of all facilities but it was still great value for money and location was perfect. It is nice to be able to stay in Singapore without having to ride elevators all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JM1609
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very special. Professional, helpful staff. Restaurants excellent. Room spacious and over looked the pool. Great location. Would only stay at this hotel if visiting Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in the City”
Reviews.Author: Driver5
Reviews.Content: Room was large, clean and a kingsize bed. Breakfast choice and short order cook superb. Bar shut at 11 pm which I felt was a bit early for Singapore. Pool side service was very hit and miss had to find staff to reorder drinks.. Good location for shopping. If you want a quiet hotel this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: schramko
Reviews.Content: couldn't ask for a better hotel Service spot on They gave me a room to freshen up after I checked out, in the morning , in the late afternoon before my flight..... brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Hubbleys
Reviews.Content: Singapore is full of quality worldclass hotels, we visit on a regular basis this time we decided on the Goodwood Park, 1st time and last time the room was small and porrly laid out. To watch the TV you had to stand by the door at 90o to the bed!!!!!! When i complained to reception the only response i received was ' you can see the swimming pool from your balcony' true if i was a girraffe and was leaning over the balcony. I want a nice well laid out room not a broom cupboard, also a positive response from the staff as apposed to the one i received

Reviews.Title: “Such attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: pattap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September. From the moment we arrived we were given a warm greeting and this continued throughout our stay. Our room 351 was a room which I had requested as it opened up onto the smaller pool area with your own small patio with chairs and a small table to enjoy relaxing, the room was lovely not large but hey how long do you plan to stay in your room we literally just slept there and were out and about all day. The hotel is spotless and although I had read some reviews of people complaining about there rooms this was not the experience we had. A must is the afternoon tea it was a buffet not like the Ritz but this was better as you could help yourself and there was so much choice and it was very reasonably priced. The breakfast each day was also buffet style with a good choice but my only complaint would be it was not as hot as I would have liked it to be although I realise keeping food hot is not easy. All of the staff we came across we very polite and helpful and seemed generally happy in their jobs.Singapore is a beautiful city and we will go back again as soon as we can .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VazzaSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels you could stay at. A beautiful heritage building located near Orchard Road and shopping district. Staff are wonderful. Rooms are clean and a good size. 2 Pools which are great. Breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very historical building - excellent spacious and calm rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelexpert009
Reviews.Content: This is a very special hotel, off the beaten tracks. Certainly one of Singapore best locations you can get. The rooms are huge, calm, and very clean. Breakfast is served in a art deco breakfast room. Staff is friendly. Good Place to be for high tea. If you are out for business, maybe the location is a little bit remote, compared to the other chain hotels, but the room size is certainly compensating. Prices for internet and breakfast are rather on the very high side and management should revise these.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel,excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderSneek
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on a stop-over in Singapore.Charming hotel in the neighborhood of Orchard Road.Perfect breakfast.Tip : don't go to the Thai Village restaurant next to the hotel: it is more Chinese restaurant,good rood with poor service

Reviews.Title: “Old charmer”
Reviews.Author: oldromantic13
Reviews.Content: Booked in for our wedding anniversary, and found the Goodwood slightly better than our last stay 2 years ago. Our room (by the quieter and more charming of the two hotel pools, the one in the Mayfair courtyard) was fresher and looked as it had been done up recently, muted greys, a stone wall and spacious enough. The bed had a firm mattress with a softer layer on top, and real down pillows which mould themselves around your head. Louvered window blinds looking onto the greenery around the pool, very pretty. Peaceful, too. The room had all the bits and bobs you'd expect, although the bottle of shampoo was strangely minimal, suitable for one person, although no doubt they would have brought another if we'd asked. The service was a bonus - all the staff said a cheery hello whenever they met a guest in the corridor. Dinner in the grill room was uniformly excellent, around $100 each without getting carried away, with reassuring food cooked well rather than anything show-off. Buffet breakfast didn't have the range of many other bigger places, but everything was just right - pain au chocolat light and crisp, ommelette firm on the outside and creamy in the middle, bacon crispy (and real, not the ersatz turkey bacon that is so commonplace these days), and coffee the standard benign and slightly bland hotel brew that doesn't offend but doesn't necessarily delight either. Overall the Goodwood has a pleasingly faded old colonial style without being crusty and pompous, and was a good balance between a big impersonal "business" hotel in terms of amenities, and a small, friendly hotel in terms of the service. And only five minutes' walk from the shopping malls of Orchard Road, if that's your thing, at the same time as being peacefully removed from all the bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: extacy2508
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel to celebrate our 7th anniversary. Have always wanted to stay in this hotel as its a really beautiful and elegant hotel with a history. Rooms were spacious and well appointed. Location is unbeatable as well with its close proximity to orchard road. The hotel also has a great tea time buffet at cafe l'espresso where small canapes are served.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 4 star hotel - but make sure you get a room in the main building!”
Reviews.Author: CeeAK
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, good service, good food (The Chinese restaurant is probably the best I've been to!) Sleeing quality excelllent for my taste! When we first got to the room it was in the "old wing" of the hotel, and the mildue smell was unbelivable... We were moved to a new room facing the pool and this was excellent. Short walking distance to Orchid Rd. This is a typical business hotel, but it is also nice for leasure. Nice pool area, but maybe a little small and definately not enough sunbeds... Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: eworrell
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nicely appointed rooms in a "colonïal" style. It has only a two stories around the swimming pool, which is a breath of fresh air in a city dominated by high rises. The rooms are great and also in style of the hotel. Every day fresh fruit in the room!! Breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShortVisit
Reviews.Content: Really nice old chartacter hotel. Got a room in the old part over looking Scott's Road, very nicely re-furbished, large room with lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice quiet , refined hotel . Convenient location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Docker30
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. Internet access excellent . Breakfasts sumptious Two pools - One very private

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Classic, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: roxipod
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Goodwood Park Hotel and I was more impressed than during my first stay where I felt the rooms were in desperate need of upgrading, considering the price of rooms at this hotel, and the great number of other options in Singapore. This second stay, my room was immaculate and classic and had the feel of it's history without making the guest crave modern simply because of lack of maintenance and upgrade. I also think they should not charge extra for internet...I mean come on. I do still think the hotel could invest in upgrading the rooms and especially the gym, however my overall review and remembrance is that the staff were exceptional, helpful and available at every turn and that the food and beverage (restaurants, cafe, boutique) keep up with the 5-star element, and that the lobby areas all have a great buzz and livelihood!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a bustling city!”
Reviews.Author: LindaSussex
Reviews.Content: We really liked Goodwood Park - a real old colonial style hotel, just 2 stories high, right next to Orchard Rd the main high street in Singapore. We were recommended the hotel by friends and were not disappointed. We requested a room overlooking one of the pools which was very good. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was excellent. The larger of the swimming pools was a perfect place to relax after a day of sight seeing and walking. We had the afternoon tea which started at 3.30pm and went on until 5.30pm - all you wanted to eat and 2 drinks included. No need for dinner that night! We were able to walk everywhere from there but the underground system was cheap,clean and efficient. Would recommend a night boat trip around the harbour. 45 mins with everything lit up and giving a good overview of the city. Enormous choice of eating places along the harbour for after the boat trip. If you like walking we would recommend the MacRitchie reservoir a few stops on the underground outside the city. An enormous reservoir with various shaded walks amongst the monkeys and other wildlife. We chose that over the commercialised Sentosa Island for a day out. Went to the top of the Sky Park for stunning 360 degree views of the city and higher than their equivalent of the London Eye. A great few days in a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller1609
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel with character as opposed to the usual predictable 5* hotels and the Goodwood Park was a fantastic choice. Situated conveniently just 5 mins from Orchard Rd, the location was ideal. Rooms are huge, very spacious and immaculately clean and all of the staff were most polite and very helpful. If you are looking for a stylish, classy hotel with a bit of character, then you can not do better than here! Highly recommended and we will certainly stay here again when next in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely: the pool side suites are well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Jo S
Reviews.Content: Gem of an old hotel in the centre of Singapore. Great location (better than Raffles) with a feeling of old world charm but nicely done inside. Good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Killcare
Reviews.Content: We'll be back. the location is superb very handy to Orchard Street. Our room overlooked the main pool. The pools were delightful (one a little more secluded) after a long flight. Resturants were superb and with the Australian dollar wow. The hotel had enormous towels which were changed morning and evening. The hotel is the old colonial style with beautiful gardens the Raffles style which made it very relaxing and a change from the concrete jungles many hotels are nowdays.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMARAKA
Reviews.Content: It is not a luxurious hotel, but certainly a very simplistic, friendly, clean and well located hotel. It is the heart of Singapore moments from Orchard Avenue and all the famous shops and bars, etc. We were very impressed. It was a shame the spa was not within the hotel, but the treatments there were very good. The food and the Goodwood is good and varied. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated rooms, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: subpardriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business, had a suite. No television in the bedroom, which was weird. Large, nice bathroom. One night was awakened at 3 AM by drilling so loud the front desk could not hear me when I called to complain. Then they told me it had stopped, but it continued for 45 minutes. It finally stopped for good. As "compensation" they first offered late checkout on last day, then 25% off of one night stay (out of six). Pretty underwhelming considering it completely ruined sleep that night. It is quite an old building, so the interior areas are generally dark and a little musty. breakfast was good but not great. Fitness center is small and very cramped - 1 treadmill and 1 elliptical machine

Reviews.Title: “Goodwood Hotel - The Best”
Reviews.Author: lecteuravide
Reviews.Content: We have been to Singapore many times but this was our first stay at Goodwood Park Hotel - from now on we won't stay anywhere else! This hotel experience was the best. Service is efficient, friendly and so polite. Miss Precious in the Coffee Shop is a delight :) I booked 2 Deluxe rooms for our party and we were upgraded to the Junior Suites, as well as being given S$30 per day per room vouchers to spend in the Coffee Shop - very nice. Our suites were wonderful - very spacious, beautifully appointed and came with luxe feather pillows - my idea of heaven! The location is superb - a short walk to the Ion end of Orchard Road (and the Orchard MRT Station) and the hotel has 2 pools, a good range of dining options, and the best English High Tea in Singapore. Checkout was midday so we packed up and left our luggage with the Concierge Desk while we visited the Zoo. When we returned (all hot and steamy) we were offered a "Courtesy Room" in which to shower and change before leaving for the airport (no charge). This is a wonderful hotel, and not overly expensive compared to other hotels in SIngapore. As I said - we will never stay anywhere else in Singapore now. We are Goodwood Park Hotel converts!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shadykhan
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel apart from it being a "heritage" hotel is its location...a 5 min walk from Orchard. Fantastic service and good spacious rooms. Breakfast however could do with a few more western options if you dont like asian breakfast to kick off your day. Also felt like it was a popular hotel for brunch cause it was invariably filled with people at all times of the day. The best part of the Mayfair tower where we stayed was that it had its own little pool so was perfect for both of us, unfortunately didnt get to use it as much as we would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Good old Goodwood Park”
Reviews.Author: vanhiephoang
Reviews.Content: Good to be back, this is maybe the best in Singapore. - Goodies: rooms are big, staff very polite, nice design, maybe one of the nicest near Orchard road. -Badiest: - one nite all the light went on at 4 am , i switched it off, it came back after 3 times and I called the service and took out the room card, but the night was spoiled. Next day they repaired it - Since my room lacated next to the pantry of the staff hence more noice than other. - Never go to UNIVERSAL studios , it cost you ~ 50 USD and for everything you have to queue to ~ 1 h !!!!!! the fun last 30 seconds, some are just louzy games, better go shopping or to the zoo, it is good, FORGET the SENTOSA, only tourist trap to spend money for nothing, and you will lose a lot of valuable time !!!

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel, good location, but extras really add up”
Reviews.Author: brandenburg5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and were glad we got a good deal online for this hotel. The building and setting are very pleasant, and having two pools plus a small gym is perfect. The room, in the new wing, was a reasonable size though not huge. It was great to be able to walk to Orchard Rd so quickly - lots of great places to eat in Ion Orchard and 313 Somerset for example. We had one dinner in the hotel, at Min Jiang. This Chinese restaurant is excellent and well known locally. We were rather shocked by the prices charged for internet and breakfast, not included in our nightly rate. I think I've never been quoted such high prices for these two 'extras' anywhere in the world, and I travel frequently and stay in some fairly high-end hotels. The internet was sluggish and the breakfast was good but not amazing, so the high prices really did not seem justified. For that reason I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellenga
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Goodwood Park in late May for five nights, we were visiting Singapore for a reunion. We were allocated a room in the ‘new’ wing, built in 1962. Our room was spacious with plenty of storage space allowing us to empty our suitcases rather than live out of them . . . The room was clean and comfortable. We slept well and we were not bothered with any outside noise or any noise from within the hotel. Breakfast each day was a pleasure. Not a large selection as some hotels, but large enough that I was happy with the choice and eggs were done to order. The staff removed dirty plates promptly, without being asked. All the staff that we spoke to were pleasant and helpful. We only had one evening meal in the hotel, which was tasty and hot (heat, as well as spicy – we like spicy). The hotel has two pools, one, which is large, near the main foyer, and another smaller pool near the ‘new’ wing, which looked quiet and inviting. Unfortunately I never got to use either due to the reunion. The Goodwood Park is within a five minute walk of the main shopping area of Orchard Road and the local underground rail station. If (when) we return to Singapore, and the exchange rates are still in our favour, we will return to the Goodwood Park.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place-will be back”
Reviews.Author: Maffradasher
Reviews.Content: The Goodwood Park Hotel is what I would call a smaller version of Raffles Hotel in Singapore. It has loads of charm and the ambience is like it's from another time despite modern amenities. It hasn't got what I would refer to as the whole 'McDonald's, high rise, they are all alike' thing going on. It has a personality. It is a part of the history of Singapore. Afternoon tea is a real highlight and the room service was always prompt. The spa service was lovely and is situated just around the corner. The hotel has two swimming pools - a large pool in an open area but then a little gem of a pool, called the Mayfair Pool which is like a little hidden private treasure. The location is terrific, being just off Orchard Road. This is the third time I have stayed here and I will do so again when I go back to Singapore. Totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Diana160
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on our way to a resort in Malaysia. I chose the Goodwood Park mainly for its proximity to the central shopping area and was pleasantly surprised as the reviews have been mixed. Our room was very spacious, the bed extremely comfortable and we found the pool and garden a "little oasis" in the heart of Singapore. The room was good value for money, but prior to booking I enquired by email about a room and breakfast package, but they did not offer one. On checking in, late in the evening and tired from the flight and having difficulty understanding the desk clerk, I was offered an additional package which included breakfast, free internet and 2 items of laundry free each day. - , so I took it, but it was not good value. For 3 nights of course you only get 2 days of laundry and internet. I have never experienced this 'last minute package offer' before and on reflection feel they offer it to guests when they are at their most vulnerable. My system told me their internet connection is not secure, so it was no different to an internet cafe. I would just pay for breakfast next time. The service in the restaurant and lounge was very good, but we found that many of the desk staff had a very poor understanding of English. If you stay here, make sure you have the High Tea - it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Goodwood Park - Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SueYoull
Reviews.Content: Goodwood Park is very traditional hotel , We have stayed at the Goodwood Hotel many times very similar to Raffles style hotel and beautifully decorated, and rooms very spacious. Wonderful sweeping staircase to take you to your rooms. Staff are very helpful. Two pools to this city centre hotel , a small garden pool area very quaint , and the main pool superb. It is quite busy on an afternoon as they do the most splendid afternoon teas , but not that busy its overcrowded. Great breakfasts, in a very modern restaurant surrounding, but nice and airy . With a conservatory. The hotel is really close to Orchard Road , main street for shopping , Tangs’ store is a must , and at Christmas’ the retailers go out of their way to gift wrap everything no matter how small ,and the Christmas lights and decorations are so magically . Hotel is very close to the MRT , and only a few stops away from , Singapore eye , Raffles , Clark quay ( great for restaurants). Sue Youll UK

Reviews.Title: “Keeping my fingers crossed”
Reviews.Author: arunb10
Reviews.Content: I plan on staying in this hotel from June 8, 2011 through June 11, 2011. I made my reservation with this hotel before reading the reviews on this forum. Now I am really concerned about the room I am going to get. I am traveling with my spouse and a 2 year old for our vacation. I hope I do get a nice clean room.

Reviews.Title: “lovely old hotel but needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Sheba31
Reviews.Content: It is for nostalgic reasons that I chose to stay here. It brings back fond memories when my parents and I used to stay here when I was a child. However, I must say that the grand dame is in need of a good face lift especially if it wants to maintain the rates charged. The furnishings in the lounge needs a serious revamp. We got a Deluxe room, clean and roomy but again, the furnishings are looking a little tired. Bed was still nice and comfy with good linens. Unfortunately, with it's Durian Season promo, the pungent smell seemed to permeate into our room through the air vents. Not a fan of the local exotic fruit so I nearly died. Room service was decent. I didn't partake in the high tea buffet but passed the lounge everyday and it was certainly a decent spread. I must recommend it so bring your appetite and if you are on a diet, don't stay here. The pool was unattended so you have to bring your towels from the room. The waiter servcing the pool said he would speak to housekeeping to get us towels but they never arrived so I went back to the room to get some. I can only commend the staff who are ever so obliging and even extended our check-out because we had babes in tow. Would have also appreciated free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & location”
Reviews.Author: oscar_whitby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The service from the staffs are excellent especially the concierge. The room is very heritage looking however it needs some upgrading. The room has a musty smell, the central air conditioner is very noisy at night and the toilet is making funny noise after using it. However, the room is very spacious and house keeping is excellent. The internet service should be provided free with the stay, not as an extra charge of S$30++. We finally found a prepaid internet service which only cost us S$15 for 1GB that last us for our entire stay in Singapore. The food at the restaurants are excellent, especially to David for his excellent service during our dinner at the Coffee Lounge. Overall, we had a lovely stay at the Goodwood Park Hotel to end our 2 weeks holiday in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: dewi_1980
Reviews.Content: I do like this one hotel (Goodwood Park). The cleanning service (i have forgotten his name) is so polite. I think all of them is polite. The room is comfort, warm, and my boys really enjoyed it. Hopefully, i will come back again Goodwood Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - deluxe rooms are 2-3 stars at best.”
Reviews.Author: barnskybeat
Reviews.Content: While the location of the hotel is good the rooms leave much to be improved. The deluxe rooms are small and sub-standard besides the fact that rooms in Singapore tend to be overpriced anyway for what you get. For US$ 200 you will get an excellent executive room in Bangkok but in Singapore it only gets you a sub-standard deluxe which needs some urgent refurbishment. The carpet in my first room had just been cleaned and instead zof airing it sufficiently they put me in and after one night I needed to change since the smell of chemicals was unbearable. Instead of upgrade me ( a decent hotel would have done so for the inconvenience caused) I was moved to a smoking room where I had another type of very annoying smell. All other rooms were booked. Overall the place is very disappointing and the hotel does absolutely not live up to my expectations. Bad service and management, overpriced and sub- standard.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie A
Reviews.Content: I loved the Goodwood Park Hotel, Singapore. The staff were friendly and very amicable, could not do enough for us. The hotel is very clean, in a great location and there was nothing I could fault. The High Tea was thoroughly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: SIStraveler
Reviews.Content: First, I'd like to say that the staff and service at this hotel were top-notch and exactly what you'd expect when staying in a 5 star hotel. However, everything else was lacking. When I arrived, my room wasn't ready which was fine because I arrived before check-in due to my flight. I left my luggage there and went to Orchard Road. When I returned after check-in time, I was escorted to my room but the smell was overwhelming. Even the bellman who escorted me to the room told me that I should call and request a different room. After 10 minutes, they found another room for me but it was without the bacony I had specifically called ahead to request. I was happy because this room didn't smell. That night, I ordered room service and stayed in to watch the Royal Wedding. When they brought my meal, it was completely overcooked and inedible. I called and had them make Fish and Chips for me instead. They did, and these were just okay. I had a horrible night's sleep because the bed was incredibly uncomfortable. It was a king size bed, but just two twin beds pushed together. The middle was really hard and uncomfortable where the two beds met. The shower is really tiny with a shower curtain that flowed in against my body pushing me up against the wall. I tried to eat there again the next day and had lunch with a visiting friend at the pool side restaurant. The pizza was doughy, hard to eat, and kept falling apart and his nachos were disgusting. Overall, the service was excellent but there is not much for them to work with. The rooms and food are more than disappointing. Not worth the money and doesn't deserve the 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “An awful nightmare”
Reviews.Author: zades11 Posted by a Viaggiare traveler
Reviews.Content: A place with no hope. Rated as a 5 stars it barely reaches the 3. The appearance would be fancy but the moment you arrive in the hall you'll feel like you're in a noisy railway station with no class or charme. De luxe rooms have a very tiny bathroom and if you ask for a room with a wooden floor you'll enjoy of the parking backyard view then. Rooms need absolutely to be renovated since the carpet smells of smoke, wine (??) and other mysterious odors. The worse aspect, anyway, is the terrible noise from the street or the pools, so definitely there aren't really quite rooms. The staff would like to help you to find the best possible accommodation for you, but unfortunately they've to manage very poor resources. Internet is on payment and pretty expensive and wi fi doesn't work fully though. I believe I've had the chance to have some extra noise as a bonus given by the workers that were drilling in the backyard. Recommended if you don't need to sleep and like to enjoy the traffic noise. (I'm obviously ironic...)

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1081
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the deluxe suite at the Goodwood Park Hotel, Scotts Rd for 2 nights for a business trip in Singapore. The hotel looked like a colonial mansion and is a sharp contrast to its surrounding buildings in modern Singapore. Right beside the hotel is the Far East Plaza where you can find food and shopping while ION Orchard is within walking distance from Goodwood Park. Although this hotel is not located along Orchard Rd, it is well located in the heard of shopping and business district. The ambient in hotel lobby is relaxing, more suited for leisure travel than business travel. Reception was friendly and efficient. I booked the deluxe tower room but on arrival I was upgraded to the deluxe suite. The deluxe suite was clean and comfortable. The general area of the suite were spacious though I wished for more space to maneuver my bags onto the chest. It was hampared by the ceiling-high column beside the bed and the dressing table chair. The suite was pretty quiet at night. Occassional the sound of room doors being closed can be heard though that did not detract from a good night's sleep. An unpleasant experience I had at the hotel was the somewhat unfriendly housekeeping staff. I requested for an iron and ironing board to be delivered at 10.30 pm to my room. The staff delivered the items requested in a brusque manner as if I should have the cheek to disturb him at 10.30pm with such request. He handed over the iron and the board, expecting me to carry a heavy ironing board into the suite by myself and left without a word. Despite that, the hotel is a great place to stay in Singapore. Great location and comfy room. And from March to July 2011, they have the durian fiesta where the hotel cafe sells durian cakes and pastries. For the durian lover, this is a must try. The durian mousse cake and durian tarts were excellent! I rate the hotel at a 4 or 4.5 but with the unpleasant housekeeping, I downgraded the hotel to a 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “What a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Whathow
