Reviews.Content: The hotel system was and is still down for almost 2 hours now. So basically they could not allocate rooms or do up any keys. Overall service and handling of the situation is poorly executed. Was expecting a lot more for such a reputable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Alokie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the heart of Orchard road shopping and dining. The historic nature of its building takes one back in time, without missing out on modern luxuries and creature comforts.

Reviews.Title: “The connoisseur's hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bmozz
Reviews.Content: An elegant, comfortable hotel in which to really feel at home. I used to stay when visiting on business some years ago, and found the rooms sensitively updated and the service as excellent as remembered. A ground floor room with access to the smaller and more private pool was quiet and restful. One surprise was that wifi was not free. Otherwise, the ideal place to have as a home while in the bustle of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gravity6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steeped in history and the old entrance hall is spectacular. We had two rooms, one was quite large the other (overlooking the smaller pool) was a bit smaller but still nice, each had its own balcony with seats. It is on a large block and you have to walk up a hill to get to the entrance, so wasn't great for one of our party who has mobility issues. Close to Orchard Rd and the MRT. Only complaints were no free internet access that I could find and the bed was a bit hard for my taste (but I still slept well!!).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JuneMalmer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Goodwoodpark for the past 4 yrs , we chose it because the Parklane suites have balconies for my husband to smoke and to air our golf shoes and golf clubs. Other than that the suites are dull , old and smell damp . The aircon is so ancient that it drips endlessly when it runs for too long . The front door to room doesn't even fit . Management does even check on the proper running of the rooms. Shower curtain hangs just at the edge of the bathtub , when shower is on the floor gets dangerously wet . Tiles in bathroom need to regrotted . In fact the whole bathroom is in dire need o a face lift to catch up with modern civilization . I am not an electrical appliances fanatic but I definitely have a much better set than the hotel. Pricing is wrong . Internet is over price d, hotel charges S$30 a day , just down at the shopping mall at the Paragon , internet connection is free , just head on to the Singapore Promotion Board along Orchard Road , the nice ladies will explain hook up to free surfing . And the internet connection is still stuck at the stone age era. For ourselves we will stay there again , smokers don't have too many choices nowadays, but convenience and size is tops . But again there are many newer hotels along Orchard and others which have understood the importance of reinventing themselves to keep up with the times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, restful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brunswick_travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Goodwood Park on the advice of our travel agent. We were a bit concerned initially that it was up the 'wrong' end, i.e. the end of Orchard Rd rather than down in the Raffles end of town. However we were so pleased in the end that we stayed there - it's really close to the MRT so it's easy to get around and having had a look down the Marina end, it's far less touristy (though in Singapore that still means large malls!). The grounds of the hotel are large, semi-tropical gardens and quiet and it's a really nice retreat from all the mayhem. There are two pools and we stayed overlooking the main one (which gets a bit more sun though they could maybe do with a few more lounges) and I recommend gettting a room that overlooks the central garden so you can cut across (it's quite a long way round through some tasteful but essentially boring corridors otherwise!) The staff were polite and allowed us to extend our room booking since we had a late flight out and we very much appreciated that. Overall we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ilide Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as a bit of luxury on our return journey home from a 6 week holiday - we were not disappointed! The location, food and service were excellent. The hotel is located within walking distance from all the shops and malls.

Reviews.Title: “Charming actually”
Reviews.Author: Tuban90
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews here, I was a little nervous about staying at the GWP Hotel. However, I was arriving from an underdeveloped country (transit point), so frankly, anything would have been 5 stars in my book. I think a lot of the complainers here should try and do that - arrive from a poor country, and let's see how much complaining you can really do. The hotel is old (yes, there is a slight "old" smell, but you really don't notice it) and as such has a certain charm. Rather than calling the rooms "old" and "dated", I considered them "clean" and "retro" (art deco chic, esp the lighting behind the bed! cool!). The bathroom (most important to me) was SPOTLESS and beautiful - all marble. Hot water, excellent water pressure, and great toiletries. The swimming pools are beautiful. The service was prompt and polite. The bed was very comfortable. It was quiet at night. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, and I have no idea why people are so disappointed with it. I paid slightly less than I would have at the ritzier "new" hotels. The high tea buffet was beautiful and leisurely - a highlight for me for sure. The only thing I'd say is that the Internet access should be free.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: PeterStreetwise2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is indeed a gem! There are few low-rise, three storey hotels left in Singapore of this quality. Almost everything about this hotel was impeccable. The room was completely silent and the bed superb. There is a second very private small swimming pool at the back of the hotel and one is able to access it in two ticks from the room. Again, the public areas in the hotel are also impeccable and there is even a small museum of Tang Dynasty treasures. The restaurants and coffee lounge are also of a very high standard. But the front desk staff need more training, - some are with it and some are not. I would all things considered certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poolside room is a bit too small”
Reviews.Author: sipnslurp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in June 2010. Overall impression was a good one. Hotel has a nice "old" colonial style with some modern touch on the inside. Staff was polite and helpful. However, best aspect of the hotel is its great location. 5 minutes walk will take you straight to orchard rd. The only downside of our stay was the room size. We were given one of the poolside room on the ground floor which is really really tight. We barely have space to put our luggage aside. The room also has a private balcony area which was a little bit dirty due to the rainy weather. One couple got married on the poolside during our stay which added a little memory on the hotel. Anyway, overall it was a good stay and wouldn't mind to revisit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “In one word, "Superb"”
Reviews.Author: akra12
Reviews.Content: I am from Singapore but I booked this hotel for my husband's surprise birthday party. I really don't regret for my decision. Hotel is very impressive and Rooms were clean. Front desk staff were providing prompt service. Pools are very lovely except the main pool is in front of restaurants. So it's hard to see anyone using it. The small pool is beautiful except the kids area doesn't have any distinct separation. So it's bit uncomfortable for young kids to use. I requested for DVD installation. Hotel promptly supported my need. As I traveled with 2 kids, they provided an extra bed as a complimentary service. Hotel's location is in the main belt of Orchard. So it's so convenient. We requested in room service for food. The food was a bit expensive but tasted good. The buffet was nice. Hotel can improve their policy for complimentary coffee and tea packets. They keep only 2 packets of coffee and creamer at a time. I need to request every time. Otherwise I have no major complaints. All in all, kids enjoyed their stay at hotel and I find it's absolutely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgia Hotel Needs Some Reinvestment”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: When I was growing up in Singapore in the 1980s I used to come to the Goodwood Park quite often for lunch with my parents at its cafe, dinner at its Japanese restaurant or its Gordon Grill, or to visit the excellent pastry shop. I have many memories of roaming the hallways with a primary school friend while our parents were having dinner, although I hadn't stayed at the hotel except in its loft extension rooms in 1982 when we first arrived in Singapore. Last month I was attending a conference at the Grand Hyatt but on the Monday the hotel was full so I opted to stay just up the street at the Goodwood Park. When I rolled up in my taxi to the lobby, the numerous facelifts had not erased the basic layout of the foyer and I was immediately transported back in time to a personally meaningful period of my life. That reverie was interrupted however on check in, when I was told that internet access would be very complicated that I couldn't disconnect from the connection once made or I'd be charged multiple times (which was not the case). I walked past the main pool, escorted by a very friendly valet, to a back elevator that took me to my room (it overlooked the secondary pool, which some of the past reviewers seem not to have been aware of as it is much more private). The room was fairly attractive in a classical way, with very yellow lighting setting off the vaguely 1990s tropical luxe decor of the room. The bathrooms were small, but hotels of this era all have bathrooms of that size so I was not taken aback. I was surprised that the plumbing rather groaned everytime I used the facilities, which I suppose would be an acceptable level of charm for leisure visitors, but does seem like a minor but fixable issue. The internet was quite straightforward. The room had a nice balcony area which I unfortunately didn't have time to use, but which might again be nice for visitors that planned to take an afternoon siesta. The plusses of the hotel are its food - its local selection at the cafe were myriad, somewhat pricey but excellent value for the quality. I was impressed. I dropped into the Gordon Grill, where I remember celebrating some academic achievement with my now late parents, but was disappointed to find the menu had been expunged of most of its Scottish touches. I'm sure the food is still good but didn't have a chance to try it. The tea time buffet at the lobby lounge appeared very popular when I checked in. I would stay again, as the location to Orchard Road is excellent, but as a leisure traveler. I do think there are better options for business visitors, but with a few improvements and some minor refreshes to room decor and to service consistency I think the hotel would remain an attractive location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and calm, very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: MMBondiJct
Reviews.Content: We booked a room and were upgraded to a suite, and loved this hotel. Fantastic pools, lovely setting, it's not like super-modern Singapore and that's why I liked it. This place reminds you of a different time and place. The place does smell a little musty and hasn't been refurbished for a while, but that's part of the charm to me. It's not a 5 star but it is a 4 star with extras.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, helpful but mistake prone”
Reviews.Author: dxb625
Reviews.Content: Staff at this hotel are very friendly and helpful but they aren't on top of their game. Mistake prone - we checked in for 2 days but a different staff had to call us the next day to ask we when we are planning to check out. Rooms and view aren't fantastic- definitely is quite dated and poor value compared to our first hotel at the Conrad Centennial over by Marina Bay. Asked for itemized billing but all we get is a lump sum bill. The catering in charged of our wedding reception is exceptionally mistake prone. She drove us nuts with the mistakes she made in each and every email. Catering staff were dishonest - said they served the complimentary wine but none of our friends and relatives had a single drop. They were also supposed to give a complimentary wedding favor to each of our guests but not everyone got it. Definitely 'nay' if you are planning a reception at this place. Room was okay - stayed at room 166 and it definitely did not feel 5 star. An overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Junior Suite by the Pool”
Reviews.Author: shaunsia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights in their pool view Junior Suite in October. The hotel itself is very beautiful and has lots of history in it (has been there for more than 100 years now). Our Junior Suite opens the door directly to the pool and the view is stunning especailly at night. The room is very spacious and clean, and room service is promt, the reason I give it 4* is because the room has very poor sound proof wall. One morning I was awaken by the room next door as they were shouting and cheering for their friend who is getting married later that day by the hotel pool. The hotel itself is also like a labyrinth, and they do not have standard room structure throughout the whole hotel even if the room category is the same, with old colonial narrow staircase that really adds to the feel that you are back in time. This hotel lobby by the pool is a very romantic place to have high tea on a Sunday afternoon though we did not try, but I don't really like the idea of me swimming in the pool and being visible to everyone having high tea. We didn't try any of the restaurants in the hotel but their Japanese restaurant seems very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: GJMPerth
Reviews.Content: Grand old hotel with great rooms and facilities. Just a little off the main Orchard Road strip but within easy walking distance. Service was fine and the staff were very attentive and courteous. A good choice for a short stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Needs livening up”
Reviews.Author: LondonLorraine
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on my way home to UK. Had somehow thought it was in a quiet, residential location but it is firmly fixed on busy road with countless shopping malls. Not my thing. Staff were fine, but the hotel has a lot invested in maintaining an air of refined elegance which I found wearing. The place seemed to lack life and vitality. Although the high tea (fixed price buffet) is a joy and definitely worth an indulgence. Deluxe room was spacious and well appointed although the carpet and bathroom seemed tired. Loved the comfortable bed and great linen. Massive place that seems to have been extended over the years. That's lead to some lengthy corridors, and a choice of several restaurants. I think there are better options in Singapore but sure it will suit some people well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect to relax by the pool-there's a wedding on”
Reviews.Author: holydaze
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and represents pretty good value for money. It maintains some of its colonial charm and is not your bland high-rise offering Food is very disappointing. It's expensive which one would expect but my poolside lunch of nachos was a travesty of commercial barbeque sauce that a roadside diner should be embarrassed to serve. The Hainenese chicken rice was also tasteless. The most offputting thing though was the rudeneness of the staff. I was lying by the Mayfair pool and without uttering a word to me, 5 o5 6 staff appeared began assembling tables and chairs all around me-literally within centimetres of me. When I stood up, they whipped my sun lounge away from under me. I complained to the duty manager that this was the rudest treatment I'd ever seen in a hotel she looked perplxed and told me it was beyond their control because there was a wedding on. Haven't they heard of a sign saying "pool closed between xand y time? I wouldn't have minded if staff had excused themselves and asked if they could assist me to move-but no they just acted like I was something in their way. The fact the manager didn't understand that their was a better way to do things is concerning. It's also obvious that house guests play second fiddle in accessing the amenities to the multiple weddings every weekend at this hotel. I thought I'd give the G'woo Park a try for old times sake, having stayed there as a child with my parents but i won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, but there's potential”
Reviews.Author: FoodEnthused
Reviews.Content: The hotel's facade is charming and colonial, however the rooms are a different story. Our room was spacious, but the bathroom was very small. The lourves at the window were broken, the aircon not sufficiently cool, and we found it odd that one side of our almost-colonial-style room was modern design with a cold slate wall and modern lamps. My husband and I had the impression that all hotels are suppose to record all details of occupants in a room when checking-in. However, when I wanted to charge a coffeehouse bill to our room, they rejected and refused to allow me to do so because they had no record of me being an occupant of the room - then why do I bother letting them have my passport and signing their form when we check in? For the price we paid, the room is totally over-rated, and the rustic colonial facade of the hotel is merely just a facade. We probably won't be hurrying back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OzBrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week. The rooms were large and clean. Hotel and service were both five star. Hotel staff were very friendly. Located in Scotts Road very close to Orchard. Handy to the shops and restaurants but tucked away so it's like a little oasis. We would definitely stay again (and again)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel, a combination of old...”
Reviews.Author: Jakartaone
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, a combination of old time romance and modern time. Everything was nice except for a hawker kind of breakfast with a 5 star price. Instead of having breakfast at hotel i'd rather have a lil walk to lucky plaza and have a 5 dollar chicken rice....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character but needs better service”
Reviews.Author: RKrieger
Reviews.Content: I always had a soft spot for this hotel. I appreciate the architecture and love the big traveller palm trees outside the entrance. I have fond memories of eating dinner at the restaurant and high tee in the afternoon. That's why I booked on this trip to Singapore a room here. I had reserved the "Parklane suite" and asked for another room, because the furniture and ambience is rather 3 star and the walk over the carpark and view not at all appealing. The reception staff was very friendly and efficient. The Deluxe room had a nice view of the smaller pool. The pool area is a very attractive garden setting and more private then the bigger pool next to the restaurants. This was the most attractive feature. However over 2 days noone cleaned away left over towels of other guests. The old TV in our room had very few channels with a poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: LarsMitchell
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly enough, although I was a little disappointed with the rooms. Simple things like the TV didn't work well and you pay through the nose to use the internet. I doubt I'd go back,

Reviews.Title: “High standard, friendly staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Remington_3555
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and friendly. Room quite big with view on the pool. Very nice hotel, maybe too fancy. Excellent location (1 mn to get into Orchard Road) so that the outside of the hotel is not too busy. However, pay attention to the extras, and particularly to the breakfast, very expensive !

Reviews.Title: “Nice heritage hotel but be careful of the house keeping staff”
Reviews.Author: Durian9698
Reviews.Content: Overall, we like the design of the hotel. Room is spacious. However, breakfast spread is limited and pricey. You have to walk to another area for swimming pool towels. It's inconvenient. Good bakery outlet for durian cakes. Overall, service is good. The cons on this hotel is that for a 5 star hotel, the housekeeping staff must have touch my eye cream which I newly bought as a huge portion of my eye cream just vanish from thin air. Impossible as how much eye cream can we used!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy atmosphere, great afternoon tea, some rooms with stale air"”
Reviews.Author: minov
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at the Goodwood Park Hotel. I like it because it is not one of the typical bunkers made of a lot of concrete. The hotel is in a historical buildling, the former German Teutonia Club. You have to however be careful which room they give you. There are some with a really stale, very humid air. The design of the rooms is not modern or stylish, rather traditional. The walls of the rooms are not very thick which means that you might hear your neighbour's child - on the other hand there is basically no traffic noise. Every afternoon the reception area is flooded by happy people who munch on these delicious little pastries, cakes and cookies. Their meeting support is very efficient and they respond to special requests. The fitness center is a little bit too small. If you come for business, make sure your booking assistant negotiates free Internet access as their charges are outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort stay”
Reviews.Author: Vishal23
Reviews.Content: Location of the Hotel is appropriate and it is close to Orchard Street (main road of the city).The structure of the hotel reminds me of the fort, but it was beautiful.Hotel staff and service was incredible.Rooms were really comfortable. Food quality was fine especially for the veggies.

Reviews.Title: “Booked in for two nights. Breakfast was...”
Reviews.Author: Dio67
Reviews.Content: Booked in for two nights. Breakfast was expensive, and the room was average. In need of a facelift. Good location for shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “In need of an air freshener”
Reviews.Author: travelchoc
Reviews.Content: the facade is impressive but the lobby is in need of severe refurbishment. the sofa chairs in the lobby should be replaced, it looks cheap. the walkways also have a musty smell. i cant help but sneeze whenever i walk along the corridors

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable base in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: GulfWanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2010. Check-in was swift, even though it was late at night, and my room was very spacious and overlooked the pool. The bathroom, too, had a decent size. The window shutters were very effective and meant the room was totally dark at night enabling me to get a good night's sleep. Breakfast was nice and had everything I wanted. Every single staff member I dealt with was extremely friendly and seemed to know what he/she was doing, so no worries here. A few more TV channels would have been nice and the bar in the lobby closes relatively early (11 p.m.), but you can sit by the pool and order drinks from Room Service. Singapore's a stunning city and I'm sure that I will come back in the future for some proper sightseeing. I would have no hesitations to stay at the Goodwood Park again.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps our expectations were 'too' high for a 'luxury' hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Zonnebloem99
Reviews.Content: We had just spent a couple of nights in Jakarta at a 5 star hotel where everything was perfect, the service was excellent, the hotel was impressive, the rooms were amazing and amenities were great and then we came to the Goodwood Park in Singapore and we had expected something similar and we were poorly mistaken. The service here was sloppy, many of the staff did not speak English (ok, we are in a foreign country), some of the staff had the 'I don't care you are guest' attitude, but overal the best thing about the hotel was the location and the way it looks on the outside. Not to be harsh, but the 'cheap' rooms (SGD 185) we stayed in really needed to be updated and modernized; the carpet (also in the hallway) needs replacement (very faded and old); the main pool was quite 'dirty'; when you got in the water or close to the water, you could see dozens of little bugs in the water and there did not seem to be a pool cleaning system (maybe it was hidden). There were some other things that didn't very well at this hotel, but what I found to be most disappointing was the limited knowledge the staff had of the hotel. I was happy to checkout (we stayed 3 nights) and the process was not very efficient either (for a supposed 5 star luxury hotel). There were 3 people that ended up helping us and each one asked if we had taken anything from the minibar - 3 times?? - not very organized. Before we left, I asked to fill in a review of the hotel and when they returned with the form, they informed me that they had hired an external consultant to help improve their hotel and the quality of their service. All I could think was 'that is the best thing I've heard during my stay here; they really need it'! Maybe we expected too much, but they do advertise to be a luxury hotel and perhaps if we had one of the rooms in the tower, we would have been treated better and our opinion would different...I'm not sure...but I would not recommend this hotel after our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Style, affordability and personal service”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi3604
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in the Scott Rd - Orchard Road area. It has the style and the feel of a boutique hotel, but bigger. I have stayed at a number of hotels in Singapore over a number of years, but for my last 5 visits to Singapore this has been my preference. The staff members are attentive, helpful and personable, quite a different feel to the programmed interaction at most high-end international hotel chains, were the hotel policy and rules appear more important than meeting customers’ needs. During my last visit I had an urgent need to receive, sign, scan and email some documents before departing Singapore in 2 hours later. Even though I had checked out earlier that day staff went out of their way to help with a high degree of purpose and urgency. The two pools give a great choice between being public or private, sun or shade. The lounge area is stylish and service excellent, while the patio is relaxed and very pleasant. The rooms are large by Singapore standards, very clean and well maintained If you are looking for style, affordability and personal service then I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Kim1307
Reviews.Content: Room facing Scotts road, view shilded by frosted panes almost no traffic noise. Room clean with sufficient space and wardrobe capacity. Staff in reception friendly and service-minded. Hotel is about 500 m. from Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUT NOT FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: foxhunterCambridge
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel which is well equipped and clean, but is really aimed at commercial customers rather than tourists. Apart from a well shaded pool with only 4 sun loungers, there is no area set aside for hotel residents. Even the chairs by tables in the foyer were set aside for the sale of food to anyone who came into the hotel. Needless to say the cost of eating in the hotel was sky high and it is fortunate that Orchard Street is close by with its many food halls. So beware the implications of their publicity that this is a colonial style hotel. It is not, it is typical of a modern hotel in a very modern city. We re-visited Raffles after 35 years and although the long bar is much the same beware the Singapore slings. After watching the barman pour out 20 odd glasses of the mixture from a large jug it was clear that they are mass produced and not prepared individually. The price however was steep and the drink can be bought for much less elsewhere. A good tip is to visit the dockside around Raffles landing place. Great atmosphere with good restaurants at acceptable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel needs thorough vacuum”
Reviews.Author: Pearlie_76
Reviews.Content: The room is huge and comfy, bigger than the other hotel where I was booked during my last trip to Singapore. The bed is very comfortable and the location is excellent. Everything is within 5 mins walking distance. However, in between the sliding cabinets and closet doors are molds and thick balls of dust. The hotel is very clean to an unscrutinizing eye. There were cobwebs inside the closet which makes me wonder when was the last time somebody used the room. The TV is not at all impressive, at least not what I would expect from a five-star hotel. As a reminder to those who will plan to stay in Goodwood Park, basic items such as toothpaste, tooth brush, comb, flat iron, among others can be requested, its not automatically placed in the room. Restaurants are excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and location”
Reviews.Author: butterandjelly
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, old-school hotel in the Orchard Road area. The staff members are incredibly attentive and helpful. Doormen jumped to help you in and out of taxis, the concierge desk provided very good information, the front desk staff was efficient, and the restaurant staff was attentive without being intrusive. The hotel boasts several amenities, including two pools, a fitness center, restaurants, and a patio by the larger pool. On my first night, I had a glass of wine on the patio while I wrote postcards to send home (which they posted for me at the front desk) – an idyllic moment during a hectic trip. I was given an upgrade to a room overlooking the more secluded of the pools and it had a lovely little private balcony. After a long day of walking around and sightseeing, it was incredibly nice to sit down, organize my thoughts, and relax on the balcony before heading out to a business dinner. The breakfast buffet is wonderful – a mixture of traditional Chinese and Western foods, including a chef who will make eggs any way you like them. I loaded up on a hearty breakfast on Saturday and Sunday and was able to power right through lunchtime, stopping only for a small snack and a drink around 2pm, which is absolutely unheard of for me. Obtaining taxis was easy and it was a short, cheap ride to most of the attractions (I think the longest was about 30 minutes to the Night Safari). If you like to shop, you’ll enjoy being close to Orchard Road. There were a few things I didn’t like about this hotel. The main drawback to the Goodwood Park is the same thing you will find at any old hotel – it’s a little worn around the edges and some areas are a bit musty. For all that, they’ve done a nice overall job with upkeep. The beds were ok, though not the most comfortable that I’ve encountered. Water pressure in the shower was good but the temperature varied (I had a few scalding experiences). Internet access is not included in the room rate, which was a definite downside for me. Finally, the room numbering system is bizarre – my room was on the second floor in the 400 series yet my colleague was on the third floor with a room number in the 200 series. The place is a warren of hallways, staircases, and elevators so it’s pretty easy to get turned around until you get used to it. Overall, this is a nice hotel in a convenient area. If you like old-school hotels with some character, this might be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location but apartment style rooms need major facelift”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime2000
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good part: fantastic location. It's right on Scotts off of Orchard (shopping mecca). The staff was friendly and professional. However, the extended stay apartment style rooms need some major upgrades. Our unit was a spacious split level apartment. The building is an annex about a 3 min walk from the main hotel. The building looks dated and needs a paint job. The room was also looking aged. The living room and bedroom were fine - the bathroom and kitchen needed some major renovations. The oven, fridge and cabinets were really old. Also, the breakfast is rather pricey. However, we didn't find any restaurants that served western-style breakfast nearby. You'd have to go to another hotel which isn't really all that convenient. The gym is also very small and has the bare minimum machines.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Colonial Style Hotel in Peaceful Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: bobaliCambridge
Reviews.Content: We had excellent room overlooking the pool. It was spacious and quiet. The hotel was clean and well maintained. The staff were very friendly, helpful & courteous. Meals at the hotel were excellent although expensive. Our Agoda deal was without breakfast and so our B&B costs worked out considerably more than we had expected. We liked the location of the hotel just off Orchard Road where we were away from much of the traffic noise but close enough to the bustle of Orchard Road and Orchard MRT station not to feel isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you don't want an impersonal hotel that could be anywhere in the world”
Reviews.Author: emparav
Reviews.Content: The Goodwood Park doesn't have all the frills that some of the big chains do, however if you want something different, historical and in a great location, give it a try. My first impression of the room was that it smelled damp. However it was very clean, and had all the basic amenities. It was on the 2nd floor overlooking the main pool, and the restaurants, so always something to look at. They could do with a good renovation though! Bed was comfortable. The breakfasts were delicious! The location was fantastic! as soon as we arrived, our first time in Singapore, we strolled out onto the street, and went next door to find some cheap food in the bottom floor of the shops (a student hang out apparently). And just a 5 minutes stroll down to Orchard Rd (ION shopping centre is amazing!) and to the underground trains. The staff are all ultra helpful and efficient. Internet access was very expensive.. it was cheaper to connect on our mobile phones via global roaming than use the Hotel's! this is the worst aspect. And the TV channels were fairly limited. Our friends stayed at the Novotel.. which was a very nice hotel, great views.. but once inside you could be inside any hotel anywhere..a bit impersonal. The amenities were a bit fancier. However the location was fairly dead in the evening.. a long walk to anything.. I was alone a lot of the time, and so just had to stroll out of the Goodwood Park hotel to be in the thick of people and action, food and shops.. whereas at the Novotel, I would have felt uncomfortable walking around alone in the evening, as it was fairly dead, and a long walk from any train stop. There were quite a few weddings on, being such an historical and picturesque hotel, which was lovely to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, good with kids”
Reviews.Author: 4Shanghai
Reviews.Content: just got back to Shanghai from Singapore. Stay was great, good service, two pools - what else do you need with kids in a city. We did have a serviced apartment in the house next door, which belongs to the hotel. It is a split level, with kitchen, two sofa-beds and a master bedroom upstairs. Lot's of room with kids. So you do not need to go to the restaurant for e.g. breakfast. Can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Different and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: WhiteChinaCat
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We had a poolside suite, which while small, opened to a delightful 1920's style large pool. The staff were wonderful (special thanks to Nora, Mark, Tobias and Jocelyn), and were very helpful with all kinds of different requests. Food was excellent - definitely try the Chinese restaurant, Min Jiang (?). The thing I liked most was that in a city which can feel very busy and modern, this hotel is leisurely, set in lovely old gardens, with flexible staff. The bed linen was particularly lovely (no nasty polyester here - take note Australian Westins). The hotel is not flash in a new kind of way, but it is special. The staff all had delightful personalities. How they always remembered our names I will never know.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Overpriced. Wait, make that three: Old and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Nando1982
Reviews.Content: The Goodwood Park Hotel is suffering from a case of delusions of grandeur. Yes, the buildings are lovely and grand and historic...but that also means they're old. Luckily I managed to get the room for cheap, but I would never pay the regular rate for Goodwood (not that I'll be going back). While the service is absolutely impeccable, the rooms really do need a good sprucing up. They are large but very old and tired looking. The lifts are also so small that I could barely wheel my suitcase through the door. Also, for the rates they are charging, you would expect free internet in the rooms. On the plus side, you are in one of the best locations near Orchard Road - away from the bustle on Orchard itself, but just a 5min walk away. I didn't use any of the facilities or dining areas so can't comment on those, but the pool area looked nice enough. I travel to Singapore very frequently and have tried a number of hotels - you could do better for the money I reckon.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back”
Reviews.Author: TheMindlessTreveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with our two kids (6 & 8 y o). Had booked a deluxe room with sofa bed to for the kids to sleep in. May be good to know that the deluxe room size vary quite much depending on where in the hotel they're located. Good good service from Tobias at the front desk in getting a corner room which was spacious enough to fit the four of us for a week. Was not that impressed with the overall service level. Spent some time at the pool, but waiters was no where to be found. Came home one evening after 11 p m, but no bar open for a drink. The building and facilities is indeed quite old, and is not on par with other 4 star hotels in Spore. Good location, but overpriced considering standard and service level.

Reviews.Title: “not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: mejoolie1
Reviews.Content: Had allot of issues & at a high cost to use some were resolved. Don't stay in the parklane apartments if you have young children, the stairs are slippery high & the staff will not be able to child safe them. Staff will not let you talk to higher management if you have a problem. Go to breakfast early or the food will run out. I would not stay here again it isn’t 5 star as far as we are concerned. the apartments arn't part of the goodwood hotel they are behind you only get to use the pool & have breakfast with the hob nobs.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: mhaywardtravel
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this very nice hotel, but were not impressed. The building is very nice, position is perfect and the staff are all very courteous, however that is where the good service apparently ends. Our Deluxe rooms in the ‘old part’ were comfortable and spacious, however considering they have been recently modernised, the facilities are very basic. For example there is a large lounge area with comfortable sofas and chairs, but the only TV is in the bedroom. Considering the overall size of the rooms, the bathroom can only be described as cramped and dimly lit. There is only a bath/shower which has a high side and is difficult to get in and out of in the confined space. We also suffered with a lack of hot water in the mornings and at peak times in the evening, something which other guests made similar remarks about whilst at breakfast. Room facilities could be so much improved, if only some though had been put into the design. Throughout the hotel the staff are pleasant and courteous, however the actual level of service offered is very poor. For example the Restaurant staff seem to spend more time looking good and showing guests to the tables than they do actually providing proper service. Whilst having breakfast the used plates etc are simply allowed to pile up on your table and one has to almost trip the waiting staff up to obtain more coffee etc. On several mornings we counted at least 8 ‘used’ tables left full of dirty plates etc while persons were waiting to be seated. Not good enough when one considers breakfast costs 30 SGD extra per guest !! Breakfast variety offered is pretty average, but the service is well below that which could be expected of a hotel of this class. The same goes for the Housekeeping Staff. Rooms are cleaned daily and there is also a second turndown and re-check in the evening, however standards are pretty low. For example on arrival I noticed the previous guest had kindly left me a pile of toenail clippings under the coffee table, these remained untouched throughout the duration of my stay, I wonder if the next guest enjoyed them too! On the morning of our check-out, my mother returned from breakfast at 8 am to find that the Housekeeping boy was already in her room changing the linen and preparing for a new guest. Instead of being courteous and leaving while she used the bathroom and finished her packing, the boy remained and seemed more anxious to complete his work. This is simply not good enough for a hotel of this class, or in fact any other. Whilst checking out at 9 am, I had to queue due to the lack of staff on the desk. The One person on duty simply could not cope with the demands and paperwork of the three persons requiring service at the same time. Maybe due to the rush the girl was in, we were never asked whether we had enjoyed our stay, or if we would be happy to return. There was also no opportunity to complete any form of Guest Satisfaction Questionnaire either. The Goodwood Park is a beautiful Hotel, but service offered for price paid does not make us wish to ever return. It seems that in this place everything is an added extra, but good old-fashioned efficient service is not on the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_Skier_Walker
Reviews.Content: We wanted a warm holiday away from Europe in November, I have worked in Singapore 10 yrs ago, so we chose to go for a week. The sense of place that the Goodwood Park has is excellent a low rise hotel in SIN is different, the service was great and things like cleanliness were good too. It must be agreed that some things are looking a little shabby, particularly the exterior around the small pool area. It must be a nightmare keeping a property up to 5* standards in a tropical country but a lick of paint is needed. As to the dining: Min Jiang the Chinese was great although a touch expensive. The Coffee Lounge does a decent dinner if you are looking for something cheaper and simpler, just off a long haul flight for example. Breakfast; great but get it included in a deal before you go otherwise £££. Also - get the barman to make you a Singapore Sling (not the bottled version) Very Good and worth the expence.

Reviews.Title: “SWEET HOTEL WITH SWEET TIME WE GOT THAT”
Reviews.Author: FRANKGERMANYADEL
Reviews.Content: We love Singapore and I want to have sweet time for my wife I choose Good wood Park in Singapore for 2nights on our way to go to china and Bangkok we would each destination we will get 1 special. We loved the colonial feel of the hotel, it's low rise and very well located 2mn from the corner of Scott and Orchard roads.We booked suit room and we got much better than we expect. We had very nice bed and nice decorating in the room. We love the atmosphere and the fresh air and out door swimming pool .We got all furniture in the room was weld one. All the service in the room was really great we got sweet time with my wife. We loved it so much good time here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent junior suites”
Reviews.Author: Tejas_shah66
Reviews.Content: very good rooms, got a upgraded to a junior suite, good veg food at the resturant - fried rice , good heritage property

Reviews.Title: “Your own little bachelor pad”
Reviews.Author: reeyan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Goodwood Park Hotel for one night on 9 Aug to celebrate Singapore's National Day with a bunch of friends. I booked the Parklane studio suite as I needed a place to fit about 6 friends over for a dinner party (they weren't bunking in) and this was well suited for it. It is actually more for long-term stays like serviced apartments but they do rent out on nightly basis as well. Reception and other staff: Excellent. Very friendly and helpful. Smiles all around. Left a good impression. Complimentary parking coupons given. When our keycards didn't work, the duty manager came over to our building to change the cards for us. Building: The paklane building, which is actually in an annexe of the hotel, separated from the main building, looks rather dated, like an old-style apartment block. But somehow to me, it added a little bit of charm. Parking lots available right in front of the building. Entry is via a private lift with key card access. There is a beauty salon on the ground floor. Room: Split-level duplex. Entrance is on the second floor of the apt. Imm right is the bedroom. Staircase leading down to the living, dining, bathroom, kitchennette and large balcony. Good impressions: It was spacious and fitted all of us in very comfortably. I loved the big balcony where we could hang out and chill with some drinks. It's very quiet and peaceful. You wouldn't know that you were so close to busy Orchard Road. It's good that the bedroom is separated away from the loving/dining areas. I don't like it when the bed is in the middle of everything when you have friends over for a get-together. More privacy. The kitchen, albeit compact, was very well-equipped. It had pots and pans galore, all necessary cooking utensils, crockery, cutlery, diningware, glassware enough for about 4 people. There was a medium-sized fridge, microwave, toaster oven and stove. As my friends managed to cook pasta and such in the kitchen, it was definitely fully functional. Not so good impressions: Strong cigarette smell upon entering the room but it went away after a bit of airing by opening up the big french doors of the balcony. The decor is a bit outdated. It may have been in fashion a while back but it definitely needs some updating now. The bathroom is large, good but boring. The tiles and fittings are getting quite worn out. The TV in the bedroom is a flatscreen but the one in the living/dining is an old CTV from decades ago. Plus, it couldn't swivel so if you sat at the couch, the view is slanted. Luckily the channels are adequate. No free internet. Wireless is available at an exorbitant cost of $30 a day I think. Summary: Did I enjoy the stay? A resounding yes. If you are looking for typical 5-star LUXURY, this is not it. I've definitely seen more glamourous suites. But that's not to say that this place was shabby. Far from that. However, if you want a place like your own private apartment, then this is it. I really felt as though I had friends coming over for a cookout and party at my own bachelor pad but with the added convenience of room service and housekeeping. And the cost at SGD$270 was very reasonable. There are hotels with smaller rooms charging a whole lot more. Will definitely consider this place again for other get-togethers.

Reviews.Title: “Great memories of Goodwood Park”
Reviews.Author: rssa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days, gym is a little small, but the pool was nice, the service good, and had a feeling of leafy serenity despite being so close to the hustle and bustle nearby

Reviews.Title: “could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: boomsnap
Reviews.Content: As a few other reviewers have pointed out, it does really need some money thrown at it. The place is looking a tad shabby and needs refurbishing. It could be great, as they have the building and the history and above all the space. The room was nothing to write home about. Eating outside at the restaurant by the pool was beautiful and the food was quite good. But overall I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Sophistication At Its Finest”
Reviews.Author: daaniel
Reviews.Content: The Goodwood Park is an elegant hotel in the heart of Singapore. A Raffles-esque hotel but a lot cheaper at that. Its conveniently located on the Scotts/Orchard stretch, which makes it close to almost everything. The Orchard MRT station is just down the road and the shopping district is around the corner. Staff were pretty good, however weren't extremely welcoming. Try to nab a room with a pool view, or else you maybe stuck with a car-park view which certainly doesn't reflect on the elegance of the hotel. The choice of restaurants in the hotel is very good with a wide variety and of top quality, however cost is attached with that. I would be very happy to stay here again after a good experience. A good alternative to the Raffles. p.s; The cost of internet at this hotel is insane. Don't ever ever ever pay for it unless you're THAT desperate. There are plenty of alternatives elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Good”
Reviews.Author: smartyabhi
Reviews.Content: Yeah...This is really a good Hotel, Location-wise, Heritage-wise and ambience.... I often stay there on my brief business trip to Singapore and in March 2009, I stayed longer The staff is very groomed....The IT Support is excellent...The Banquet support is also good. But I (rather we) had real issues: - The Banquet Room Temperature were extremely Chilled and despite request, the Banquet Support guys were unable to get that optimised...contrast to this was outside HOT & HUMID Singapore....this continuous Thermal Shock to my body hit me with ill-health :< - The Room which I had this time was good in decor but basics were missing...mainly the TELEVISION set was on the right hand side of the bed Anyways..this was probably the first time I got such a room and I hope this would be taken care by the Hotel guys sooner or later by themselves. Overall, apart from the Banquet room, I rated this HOTEL GOOD.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gdlgal
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the suite facility at the Goodwood Park Hotel. The accomodations were split-level. The bedroom was upstairs at the entrance to the suite and the living/dining area, kitchen and bath were on the lower level. Bathroom was large, well lit and included a tub/shower. The kitchen area included dishes/flatware/serve and drinkware. The dining area seated four and the living area included seating for three as well as a nice work area with desk/chair. There was a large balcony with a table and two chairs. Furnishings were clean and adequate. While the suite was not what I would call "luxury", they suited our purpose and were a good bargain for the price. The facility is within walking distance of a hospital, medical offices and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing Haven in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ManxManandWoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Goodwood Hotel for two night on the way to Sydney.We upgraded our room to a poolside suite and found it roomy,clean and relaxing. The staff are so friendly and go out of their way to help you. Its a low rise hotel in the centre of Singapore and a few minutes wald to the main shopping street (Orchard Road) We had breakfast and its renound afternoon tea and found the food to be excellent. We would stay there again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again. Clean, Friendly. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: k1w1brad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a friend was having their wedding there. Beautiful Function Room (Windsor Room) Good sized Bedrooms Good sized Beds Clean bathroom room although standard more of a 4 star quality than 5 star Staff really friendly and extra helpful The Durian Festival was on so had some Durian Mousse Cake and Durian Puffs. Quite nice. Durian is an aquired taste as my wife shortly found out. Main pool nice but would rather the smaller pool to the left side of the hotel (if you are looking at the main pool from the foyer). Short walking distance (3 minutes) to Orchard Road. Been to Singapore many times and generally never have breakfast at the hotels due to the nice traditional food courts around town. If staying at the Goodwood be sure to try breakfast at Lucky Court which is only a 5 minute walk from the Hotel on Orchard Road. Walk past the Marriot turn left and you will see a McDonald's Cafe stand shortly thereafter (about 50yrds down from the Marriot) and the down the stairs walk past McDonald's (main restaurant) and keep going and you will see the food court. Mind you it is where some of the locals go so don't expect 5 star (or 2 star for that matter) but the food is nice and the price is catered for the locals. My wife and I ate there and for S$10 we had a great meal with drinksinstead of S$25++ or S$30++ if paying on the day. (++ = +Tax(10%) and + Service(10%)) Food is very nice at the hotel but for the price why not experience some traditional food. If on business or Non-Pleasure then stick with the buffet at the Hotel. Love this hotel and would be happy to stay here again. Happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned elegance”
Reviews.Author: PDR63
Reviews.Content: A frequent visitor to Singapore, I stayed at the Goodwood for the first time in feb 2009. Wish I'd tried it earlier. Great location, nice rooms, excellent staff who you can tell are long termers. No real complaints. My deluxe room had an in-the-bath shower, which is a bit below par for a 5 star hotel. But other than that it was near perfect. Lovely pools and gardens, excellent F&B. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in Singapore at the Goodwood Park!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineFamily
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old son and I recently stayed at The Goodwood Park Hotel and enjoyed our stay there. The hotel is beautiful and I loved the ambience. It is considered a top historical hotel in Singapore and in that area it did not disappoint. The room was very clean and was maintained numerous times throughout the day - we never had to wait to have our room prepared for us. The hotel breakfast, which we had included with our package, was very good and had a wide range of options. My son was thrilled that there were pancakes/waffles available. The price of the hotel was very reasonable, especially considering our package that included the buffet breakfast. The best aspect of this hotel for me was the service. I was never disappointed at the Front Desk or with the Concierge. They were always willing to help us and provided great directions and recommendations. We did some non-traditional touring on our trip, wanting to get out of the city and do some hiking, and they always provided great directions and followed up with us when we walked in the door to ask us how our day had been. They were incredibly friendly and helpful! Great staff! There are only two negatives that I would mention about this hotel. The first is the Fitness Room. I think it is a stretch to claim that they have a Fitness Room. The treadmill is truly not functional and cannot be used for running. The eliptical trainer has not been maintained well and does not run smoothly either. The weights are acceptable, but not up to a high standard. I believe that this is something that needs to be upgraded to bring it in alignment with the class of hotel it is rated. If this is an important aspect for you in booking a hotel (which it is for me), I would consider one of the larger chains, such as The Hyatt. Secondly, walking access to the hotel is horrible. We walked as often as we could because the location is tremendous and very close to Orchard Road and public transportation. There is no safe way to walk up to the hotel. You basically have to walk up the road and driveway and there were many times that my son and I had close calls with a car. Easier accomodation for pedestrian access to the hotel needs to be created for the hotel to make it more appealing. Overall, we enjoyed our stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay, great value.”
Reviews.Author: midway42
Reviews.Content: Check-in: Airport transfer from the hotel. I was met at the front desk, my luggage was brought upstairs, and I was given a tour of my room and the hotel. This was nice enough, especially considering it all happened at 1:30AM. Accomodations: Five nights in a deluxe room, their standard accommodation. The room was a bit musty but very clean. I even had a little balcony overlooking the gardens. The hotel pools are a nice touch. I would suggest a midnight swim in the smaller one, which never seemed to be busy. Dining: I visited the breakfast buffet on two occasions. Great service and above average selection (with a price to match). They do have numerous other options but I didn’t get the chance to indulge. Location: Perfect. A little out of the way (just off Orchard Road) but still close to the Orchard MRT. A little more private than Raffles with most of the same facilities. Service: As expected for a hotel of this caliber, all of the staff were gracious and willing to help. Restaurant bookings, mailing postcards, etc. were never a problem. Cost: The best part of the experience. Most of the trappings of Raffles (although not nearly as grand) at about a third of the price. Summary: Widely considered the #2 historical hotel in the city, I had a good experience and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: txpilgrim
Reviews.Content: Charming historic, locally owned hotel with friendly staff, nice decor and just a short walk to Orchard Drive. I've stayed at the Goodwood on several occassions and each stay was tremendously enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - one of best hotels to stay in in singapore”
Reviews.Author: Natalie222Uk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of hotels in Singapore (usually on business) and they all feel much the same. This one is different! Just 2 stories high, around two large and inviting pools, this hotel is warm, friendly and also brilliantly located. The ambience was great - we had a place to sit out in the evening outside our room (with doors opening out from our room onto a private patio area), and a choice of (good) restaurants in the hotel to use. The only negative - they really don't understand how to do good drinks here - the cocktails were tiny and badly done. When we come back to Singapore we'll definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everythng about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: gypsyb
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night , tired from our flight from Melbourne and from the moment we got out of the taxi we were treated and felt like royalty. I went with a friend from work and our intention was to visit the sights in Singapore over a three night stay. Our luggage was taken from the taXI and we were escorted to our room personally The staff could not do enough for us. The room was spotless, bottles of water were provided each day, the room was cleaned each day, new soaps put out. Being English we love our tea and saw we had been provided with a milk powder. A request was made to see if we coul.d have fresh milk and more tea bags. Within 10 minutes these had been provided. We took the breakfast option. All I can say is that I am now going on a strict diet !! The choice of food was great, everything from cereals and asian, to full English, toast, pastries. As much tea and coffee as we liked. On our last day our luggage was stored until it was time for our taxi aTt 8.30 pm to the Airport. We were out all day and on our arrival back at the hotel about 4.30 we were given a courtesy room to use, initially we thought for half an hour but were allowed it until we left. I cannot praise this hotel enough and am asking my Travel Agent to recommend it. All I can say is a great big Thank you to the Staff of the Goodwood Park and I hope I am lucky enough to come back one day

Reviews.Title: “Excellent start to our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter511
Reviews.Content: My husband and I transited for 2 nights in Singapore en route to New Zealand. We chose to stay at the Goodwood Park Hotel, initially because we wanted to be close to the Orchard Road shops. What we actually got was an oasis from the hustle and bustle of the city: a beautiful building, utterly professional and obliging members of staff and fantastic food. The hotel is immaculately clean, our room was very comfortable and very well equipped. The response to requests from House-keeping or Reception was immediate and at all times we experienced service with a smile. Our room was on the first floor and I must admit that there was a very slight odour of mould in the corridor, however, this was obviously known to the staff because a small machine was permanently installed to deal with the problem. We would recommend afternoon tea as an indugent experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: larryduc
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with great service but i would only class this as a 4 star hotel at the most. The positives are; the hotel is close to everything, such as shopping and transport, the place is clean and everything in the room works. The hotel has 2 great pools and a nice breakfast buffet ,along with very nice, helpful staff and a late checkout. The negatives are, the bed was very hard (new mattress needed?) the cost of eating or drinking here are over the top (but then again Singapore seems to be more expensive than it use to be) the room can be quite noisy when people are going pass in the hallway (like cleaners and other guests) so no sleeping in past 7.30am. This is my second trip to Singapore and 6th trip overseas and overall i would say a standard room here is well priced and the hotel is well located, but you might want to eat elsewhere to save on that spending money.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Trija
Reviews.Content: My niece, a good friend, and I stayed at the Goodwood Park from 30th September through to the 10th October. We could not fault the place. Our room on the third floor was large, airy and impeccably clean. The beds were firm, and very comfy. We slept like logs every night! There were ample toiletries in the bathroom, which itself was very large. Plenty of tea/coffee in the box next to the kettle, a well stocked mini bar, comfortable robes and slippers. Every afternoon a turn down service was offered, along with clean towels and bottled water. Breakfast was included in our stay, and the buffet was quite delightful every morning. Fresh fruit, cereals, noodles, rice, pastries, cold meats and cheeses, eggs cooked as you like, sausages, crispy bacon, waffles, juices, yogurts etc. The smaller of the two pools was a haven amidst the hustle and bustle, and we made the most of it every afternoon if we could. The MRT was a short walk away, and also the bus stops. The staff were amazing! No one could have been more helpful, friendly, or efficient. Idil Reuben, the Chief Concierge was a delight, as was Julian, a co-worker. They offered plenty of tips on how to get around, what to see, and what to watch out for. Room service was prompt and delightful, who can resist a little spray of orchids? For my niece's 21st birthday, the hotel organized a large bouquet of orchids for her, and also had them treated so she could take them home to Australia with her. Late that evening while in the lobby they also presented her with a birthday cake. The pianist, Eddie, in the lobby was very relaxing to listen to, late at night. He won our hearts by playing Waltzing Matilda, what Aussie doesn't love that sound? All in all, I could not recommend this hotel strongly enough. I can't wait to return there with my family again. Thank you Goodwood Park, you were the icing on the cake of a wonderful holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, spacious, best oasis pool”
Reviews.Author: webbysgirl69
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Goodwood for 3 days in April 2008 after a Star Cruise through the Malacca Straits (which was fabulous). A three story refuge amongst the towering high rise hotels, the Goodwood is elegant with harmonising and peaceful decore, and serviced by efficient staff who are quiet and unobtrusive but readily available. The Oasis Pool was a delight and I spent a whole day there under the shade of the palm trees and had almost exclusive use of it as only two other couples came along for short swims. The room was spacious and immaculate, cleaned each morning and towels refreshed again in the afternoon if required. Breakfast was brilliant as was the service. The small museum of early chinese treasures retrieved from a sunken ship was very interesting and informative. After visiting crowded Orchard Rd once, and deciding that shopping and touring was not for us, we ensconced ourselves in this haven and enjoyed the relaxing surrounds. The only detraction was that we wanted to wash our week's worth of clothes from the cruise: obtain tokens fom reception, find the laundromat located under a separate building at the rear (a bit hard to find) , cost S$5 per load to wash and S$5 per load to dry, one of the dryers is not warm enough so it ended up costing S$30 to do our washing which I felt was rather expensive. But then we found Singapore expensive for just about everything except the taxis.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis amid the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Nellie119
Reviews.Content: Having read some bad reviews of this hotel in the past, I can only conclude that they've revamped all the rooms now and it would be hard to have a bad experience. Our room was quiet, spacious and very comfortable, with a balcony overlooking the smaller second pool and its fringe of lush greenery. The decor was classy without being over-the-top. The beds, pillows and linen were top quality. Service was always friendly, attentive and helpful. The location is excellent as the shopping mall strip starts next door and an easy 15 mins walk away turns into the famous Orchard St. Despite being so close, you still get the feeling of quiet and calm; an oasis with none of the hordes traipsing by the front door. Room service is prompt. Buffet breakfast is excellent. Tiffin (afternoon tea) is known amongst the best. Their Coffee Lounge does wonderful dinners. Didn't try their other restaurants. The old building has soul and character, and the new wing blends pretty seamlessly into it. In booking here I had dismissed all those other generic hotels as being same-old, same-old. But wondered about other boutique hotels which may have offered something different, so I visited them. I wasn't disappointed with my choice of Goodwood Park Hotel. The roominess, the location, the vegetation, the serenity, the service, the handiness to everything outshone the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: aargh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Goodwood Hotel 8th-10th April 2008. The hotel itself is spectacular, with a fairly colonial looking exterior facade, but has undergone dramatic renovation interiorly. Its modern restaurant and bar flank the older part. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. The room was beautiful and well maintained. Great air con too! Cannot comment on food, as we ate out during our stay. Excellent location. Well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: hubey
Reviews.Content: Booked with some trepidation after reading some negative reviews of this hotel. However I am now convinced that some reviewers of hotels will never be pleased by anything and are deliberately negative and nit picking. This is a gorgeous colonial style hotel in a top location by Orchard Road. Its Raffles esqe but at a lower price. We booked through Wotif.com so got over 1/2 price for the room which turned out to be a beautiful 2 bathroom suite. 2 beautiful pools and a fab buffet breakfast make this a highly recommended stopover base in Singapore. We stayed with our 3 year old son, he had a spare bed and is still talking about the hotel on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the Shopping Mecca of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: EZT
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay at this property. The location is good and even ideal for those willing to go shopping. The rooms are good, a bit spartan for a 5 star property, but really appropriate. The pool is OK, a bit dated, like other parts of the hotel, but still very nice. Internet access is good but expensive. $30 SGD per day is becoming excessive. If they don't charge to use the televsion why internet. If there is a charge made to the hotel, it should be absorbed in the room charge, or else passed on at cost. This of course applies to most hotels. Ultimately, there is no extra cost for a hotel to charge for wi fi use on an unsecured network because there is no extra cost for the hotel in providing the service. As an experienced traveller, this is getting out of hand, and a hidden cost not disclosed to the traveller. But the Goodwork Park is a good property, in an excellent location. If you are in Singapore on business, you should stay in another area though, such as Clarke Quay on the river. For shopping though, or a short stopover, Goodwork Park is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An experience to remember”
Reviews.Author: coadhall
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Goodwood at the start of our silver anniversary trip to Australia. From arrival to check out the whole experience was one of being looked after, even pampered. In keeping with rest of the hotel, the room was stylish and superbly comfortable with a balcony overlooking the blocks to the rear, though this did not detract from the whole experience. You are located within a short walk from the shopping dream (or hell) of Orchard road, but far enough away to be relaxing. The staff were attentive and helpful to a fault, with a breakfast buffet to cause weight gain just by looking at it, and just how often can they freshen your tea/coffee. A must see and stay experience and we will be returning for a longer stay hopefully next time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: IrishroverBelgium
Reviews.Content: From arrival to check out, simply flawless. Outstanding team of well trained, friendly, professionals in all parts of the hotel. Rooms are spotlessly clean, well appointed. Food is highly recommended. 2nd visit in 2 months and will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Just another hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaClan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Goodwood Park 3 days in a poolside suite. The hotel interior is rather old and everywhere a smell the reminded us of old ‘n wet carpets. Internet services via TV where not working. Bathroom had only cheap toiletries that we would expect in a youth hostel. Business center was perfect but is not easy to access since always locked. The coffee lounge buffet offers the same mediocre food for lunch and dinner and has no alternating cold spreads and salads. Dinner at Gordon’s Highland Grill for two was $450 including lousy food and warm white wine. At least the service was skilled and polite. Overall a very unsatisfying culinary experience. Swimming pool area is okay but does not offer any privacy or shade. Concierge was very knowledgeable and friendly. We highly recommend the Night Safari tour and the DHL balloon.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JHinLondon
Reviews.Content: I'm beginning to wonder if some people's expectations are just unreasonable. This is a lovely hotel, people who stay here and complain must have to look hard to find problems. My room had recently been refurbished and was very spacious and comfortable. The main lobby with its cafe and patisserie were great for afternoon tea and a quick dinner. The buffet breakfast had a huge selection, with fresh omelettes made to order - my favourite. There are two pools and the smaller one is delightful and private, with trees and blooms all around. Staff were polite and helpful and arranged a treatment for me at the Aspara Spa, which is part of the hotel complex and it was sumptuous. Hotel is just off Orchard Road and near the metro station, a $15 cab ride to the airport. Perfect for a very comfortable stay and very reasonably priced when one is used to staying in tiny very average hotels in europe for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Goodwood's ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: _de_last_one
Reviews.Content: I had a few days here at the end of my 2 month trip in Asia (mainly in Singapore) and here are my observations of the Goodwood : 1) Reception area had been updated and is nice (though the high tea is held here and still too open and public, no sense of privacy at all when having tea with your friends or family) 2) Staff are still very friendly and helpful 3) Dining - the breakfast buffet's standard had dropped from a few years' back, the local high tea buffet is pretty good and very reasonably priced at S$20 (or thereabouts), Minjiang is still a good restaurant though prices had gone up a little (quite pricey), the pastry shop still serve up some good cakes and pastries, the chocolate moose cake is scrumptious 4) Room service - will inform u that it will take 45 mins but arrive in 20 mins (order was placed at about 7 pm which is peak hour on a Friday night but they still managed to get it to us on time and still warm) 5) room (this will only apply to the Parklane Suites) - definitely needs updating, it is not all bad but definitely not good in my books for a 5* hotel. see photos attached for molds in the bathroom (u can smell how musty the room was the moment the door is opened, not just the bathroom but the whole apartment), everything is old (TV is horrible upstairs as it was a wall mounted 16" TV that is about 10 years old !, a/c was not functioning well when u dropped the temperature, water droplets start appearing at the vent on the ceiling and pretty soon, u have water dripping on top of your head !, old power outlets, old and worn out closets, tables, doors that has cracks and chips on them, etc), the photos I had taken makes the room better than it looks as I didnt zoom in on the bad stuff (i only did the mold photo coz I just cant believe how bad that was) The bed is not comfortable (not firm) and the huge overhead painting's frame is just at the height of the bed when if u lift up your head from the pillow, u will hit the bottom of the frame ! Sofa in the sitting room (directly above the stairs' landing area) pulls out into a twin size bed (cant even fit two kids comfortably) 6) Pool - didnt go to the other pool but did the main one as it was closer, still hardly any shade (the palm trees are still too young to provide any shade and there is hardly any umbrellas around, only 2 !) and too open (facing the cafe and the outdoor buffet), not a great pool to swim in (not a full size coz one end of the pool had been blocked off for the kids) or even lounging around (very few loungers and not a big pool, the landscaping needs a lot of improvement as well Overall, there is a lot of improvement to be done if they are to keep up the standard of a 5* property in SIN and to charge higher prices like they are doing nowadays. The main hotel had some rooms that had undergone some renovation and I wish I had made my reservations for these one, I would rather have these nicer newer rooms as connecting than the Parklane suites.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel lacking investment”
Reviews.Author: Londonhk
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which is very disappointing. One of the Grand old Dames of Singapore that attempts to be 5 star but a combination of lack of investment, poorly trained staff and disappointing food makes for an experience not worth sampling. There are far better alternatives elsewhere in the City. The one redeeming feature is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: strtchrst
Reviews.Content: We were not supposed to stay at this hotel, but after one night at the terrible Phoenix hotel, we were desperately looking for a decent hotel, and majority of those on Orchard road were fully booked. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel has been renovated, the lobby, restaurants looked fabulous. We were given a large room which had obviously been totally renovated. Beautiful carpet, nice furniture, lovely bedding. The staff was helpful, the people at the front desk polite and efficient. The buffet breakfast was excellent. In one of the halls there is a big bowl with complimentary apples, which disappeared before we could help ourselves, as a group of Japanese tourists took the whole lot, 2 or 3 apples each! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stylish room”
Reviews.Author: jenners10
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in the Park Lane Suites which are part of the Goodwood Park Hotel. Our room is a slightly pricier multi-storey appartment but really nice - modern, stylish, spacious and very clean. Nice to have a bit of privacy in an apartment rather than a hotel room. Discount for stays of 30 days or longer - good for those on business trips (like us). Haven't eaten in the restaurant but have been lazy enough to get room service a few times and each time has been pretty awful, but plenty of great places to eat all around this area so not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Multicaster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely loved the Goodwood Park. The service and cleanliness were excellent, great location, and a really nicely appointed suite for about $120US per night. We got there via a great deal found on one of the three big internet sites (the other two couldn't touch their rate, so it pays to look at the deals each one offers). Food and facilities were awesome and since we stayed at Goodwood for about 1/3 of the rate of the Raffles, I think it's where we'll head back again. The rooms were nicely appointed, spacious, comfortable, and designed with excellent taste. The concierge captain (Idiyl Ruben) was truly superb and sized us up perfectly after a few minutes of conversation. He made a couple of excellent recommendations for quick side trips that were real highlights of our stay. This was one of our best vacation stays ever and we'll be recommending it to friends and family with no small enthusiasm.

Reviews.Title: “not fully satisfied”
Reviews.Author: ancy999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Goodwood Park last week for 3 nights. The room we got was a bit far from the reception. There was nothing special about it. The facilites provided in the room were very low, alonost no toileteries!! On our check out date, we had to leave very early in the morning, for breakfast the hotel offered to pack our 'breakfast' in a small box so we could take it with us. All there was in the box was a small bottle of juice, a small tuna sandwich (for breakfast!!!) and a croissant from the day before!!!! The only good thing about this hotel is its location because it is right in the heart of all the shopping centres which is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: SalWil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Goodwood Park for a weekend in May. When we arrived, we could see renovations were underway and were a little bit worried about what state the hotel would be in. We were pleasantly surprised. We had booked over the net and on arrival, the staff upgraded us to a poolside suite (without us even asking). The suite was huge, with two bathrooms, and everything was well-appointed and spotless. We had a nice aspect over the second, smaller pool at the hotel. The location is perfect for shopping on Orchard Road and it's only a short walk to the MRT station. The breakfast buffet is nothing special but it's fine, and we ate one meal at Min Jiang and it was excellent - delicious modern Sichuan. The service was at all times efficient and friendly. Overall, we had a good experience.

HotelInfo.Name: Goodwood Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 22 Scotts Rd, Singapore 228221, Singapore
